0.title: Credit Suisse plans sale of US asset management arm: Reports
0.article_body: Credit Suisse Group is reportedly considering a sale of its US asset management business and has launched a process for the same. Initial expressions of interest from potential buyers are due by end of this week, however, there's no guarantee of sale and the Swiss bank could ultimately retain the business. This development comes amid the bank facing multiple scandals.

1.title: 'Deepotsav' to begin in Ayodhya from October 21 with Ramlila
1.article_body: The 'Deepotsav' programme in Ayodhya will start from October 21 with Ramlila that will be staged by artists from Russia, Malaysia, Sri Lanka and Fiji. The three-day cultural programme will end on  the eve of Diwali (October 23) with the Ayodhya administration setting a target of lighting 14 lakh diyas at the Ram Ki Paidi ghat on Saryu River.

2.title: 8 people, including constable booked for defrauding police dept of ₹6.83 lakh
2.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Police have booked eight people, including a police constable and the owner of a petrol pump, for defrauding the police department of around ₹6.83 lakh by forging and submitting fake petrol bills. The accused constable, Santosh Mhatre, has been suspended from the force after the incident came to light.

3.title: 31-yr-old female sniper marries soldier she met while fighting Russia in Ukraine
3.article_body: Female Ukrainian sniper Evgeniya Emerald, known as her country's 'Joan of Arc', got married to soldier Evgeniy Stipanyuk she met while fighting Russia. The 31-year-old got married on Friday in a ceremony held in a forest in Kharkiv. A military general officiated the wedding for the couple who got engaged in August, according to reports.

4.title: Wife, 2 minor daughters kill man in TN; burn body & dispose it in forest
4.article_body: Three people were arrested after a 42-year-old man was murdered by his wife, daughters aged 14 and 15 and another youth in Tamil Nadu, reports said. The man's body was burnt and disposed of in a forest. Reports said that the man suspected his wife was having an affair and opposed his elder daughter's affair with a man too.

5.title: Naxals set ablaze vehicles involved in mining work in Chhattisgarh
5.article_body: Naxals set ablaze vehicles involved in mining activities and vandalised two other private vehicles in Chhattisgarh's Kanker on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday, an official said. The Naxals had set fire to the vehicles and escaped after the soldiers posted near the mine noticed them and launched a warning fire, according to the Additional SP.

6.title: Sensex rises over 500 pts, Nifty above 17,450 on positive global cues
6.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Tuesday with the Sensex rising over 500 points at 58,900 and the Nifty above 17,450 on positive global cues. Wipro, Tata Motors, UltraTech Cement, M&M and HUL were among the major gainers on Nifty. The stocks of BPCL and Apollo Hospitals slipped. About 1,433 shares have advanced and 443 shares declined.

7.title: India reports 1,542 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,449
7.article_body: India reported 1,542 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,060 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,449. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,913 following eight casualties in the last 24 hours.

8.title: Pat Cummins becomes Australia's new ODI captain
8.article_body: Pat Cummins has been appointed Australia's new ODI captain. The 29-year-old replaces Aaron Finch, who retired from ODI cricket last month. Cricket Australia said that David Warner was not able to be considered for the job as his lifetime leadership ban remains in place. Cummins will be Australia's 27th ODI captain.

9.title: Shoaib Malik shares shirtless pic from gym after Pak lose T20 World Cup warm-up match
9.article_body: Veteran Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik, who has not been included in Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, took to social media to share a shirtless picture of him while working out. "When quitting is not an option," he wrote. His post came after Pakistan lost their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match against England.

10.title: V-Mart acquires e-commerce platform LimeRoad for ₹31 crore
10.article_body: Fashion retailer V-Mart Retail has acquired the e-commerce platform LimeRoad for a lump sum cash of around ₹31.12 crore. V-Mart said that as part of the acquisition, the company is acquiring assets worth ₹14.61 crore and assuming current liabilities of ₹36.26 crore. Founded in 2012, LimeRoad had raised over $51 million altogether and was backed by investors including Tiger Global.

11.title: Action will be taken against auto, taxi drivers for refusing fares: Mumbai Police
11.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police will take action against auto and taxi drivers who refuse fares, under MVA section 178 (3),1988, the Mumbai Police said. "A meeting will be organised to sensitise the drivers to behave better with citizens and aid in a hassle-free commute. The police officials will be sensitised as well," the Mumbai Police added.

12.title: WhatsApp is far more private & secure than iMessage: Mark Zuckerberg
12.article_body: In a Facebook post, Meta chief Mark Zuckerberg remarked, "WhatsApp is far more private and secure than iMessage, with end-to-end encryption that works across both iPhones and Android, including group chats." Sharing a picture of a Meta ad, he wrote, "With WhatsApp, you can...set all new chats to disappear with the tap of a button...We introduced end-to-end encrypted backups too."

13.title: 2 labourers from UP killed in grenade attack in J&K; terrorist arrested
13.article_body: Two labourers from Uttar Pradesh were killed after terrorists lobbed a hand grenade in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, police said on Tuesday. The deceased, Monish Kumar and Ram Sagar, were shifted to a hospital where they succumbed to their injuries, police added. A hybrid terrorist linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba, who lobbed the grenade, has been arrested, police further said.

14.title: Samantha has put blood & sweat into action scenes: 'Yashoda' producer
14.article_body: 'Yashoda' producer Sivalenka Krishna Prasad said Samantha Ruth Prabhu has put her "sweat and blood into the action scenes" of the film. "Yashoda is a new-age action thriller. Our movie has a balanced quotient of mystery and emotions with gripping elements for audiences. On the whole, it's an edge-of-the-seat thriller," he added. The film will release on November 11, 2022.

15.title: Elgar Parishad-Bhima Koregaon case accused Jyoti Jagtap's bail denied
15.article_body: Bombay High Court on Monday rejected the bail plea of activist Jyoti Jagtap, an accused in the Elgar Parishad-Bhima Koregaon case. "From the seriousness of the conspiracy and the threat that it poses, we are of the considered view...submissions made on behalf of the appellant can't be accepted," HC said. Jagtap was arrested by the NIA in 2020 under UAPA.

16.title: BJP MP Anil Firojiya loses 32 kg after Nitin Gadkari's challenge
16.article_body: Ujjain BJP MP Anil Firojiya has lost almost 32 kg of weight after Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari challenged him. Gadkari promised Firojiya that he would give ₹1,000 crore for development work for each kilo lost. "I met Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and told him and he was very happy to know about it," Firojiya said.

17.title: 108 women freed in first all-female prisoner swap with Russia: Ukraine
17.article_body: Russia has exchanged 108 Ukrainian women held as prisoners of war for 110 Russian captives held by Ukraine, officials on both sides said on Monday. "It was the first all-female exchange," Andriy Yermak, head of the Ukrainian President's staff said, adding that 37 of the women had been captured after Russian forces took the Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol in May.

18.title: If Sisodia is arrested we'll also accompany him to jail: AAP's Sanjay Singh
18.article_body: AAP leader Sanjay Singh, who held a sit-in protest outside CBI office along with other party leaders during Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia’s questioning on Monday, said, "If Sisodia is arrested, then we'll also accompany him to jail." BJP is the party of a group of "corrupt leaders" which is afraid of facing defeat in Gujarat Assembly polls, he added.

19.title: New overbridge in Ghaziabad station set to open for trial run before Diwali
19.article_body: Rail overbridge (ROB) connecting Vijay Nagar to Ghaziabad city, also known as Dhobi Ghat ROB, will open up for a trial run ahead of Diwali festival, officials said. The 153-metre-long new ROB is meant for two-wheelers and light vehicles only. The ROB will reduce travel distance by six to seven kilometres for commuters travelling from Vijay Nagar.

20.title: Baby falls off stands as father tries to save him during Scotland vs WI T20 WC match
20.article_body: A video showing a baby falling off the stands as a man, believed to be his father, tried to save him during a T20 World Cup match between Scotland and West Indies has surfaced online. The man could be seen jumping off the stands to save the baby. Meanwhile, Scotland defeated West Indies by 42 runs.

21.title: Meta India posts 132% surge in net profit at ₹297 crore for FY22
21.article_body: Meta's India unit posted a 132% surge in its net profit at ₹297 crore for the financial year 2021-22 as against ₹128.2 crore a year ago. Its total income grew to ₹2,324 crore, which is a 56.5% surge from ₹1,485.1 crore in the previous fiscal. The gross advertising revenue increased 74% year-on-year to ₹16,189 crore during the said period.

22.title: I tried acting once & was very bad at it, it's a very tough job: Honey Singh
22.article_body: Music producer and singer Yo Yo Honey Singh said that he tried acting once and that he was very bad at it. "I act very badly...I can't act...It's a very tough job. In performing acts, the most difficult is acting, then writing and then comes singing," he said, adding that a new actor should play him in his biopic.

23.title: Kareena plays cop in Hansal Mehta film, wraps first schedule: Report
23.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has reportedly wrapped the first schedule of Hansal Mehta's upcoming untitled directorial in London. Reportedly, Kareena will be seen playing a cop in the film, which is said to be a raw and gritty movie. "Kareena counts it among her most intense roles, and did several workshops before they began filming," a source told Mid-day.

24.title: Pune has received 70% excess rainfall in October so far: IMD
24.article_body: Pune has received 70% excess rainfall in October so far, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Pune has witnessed 156.6 mm of rainfall against the normal 55.9 mm, it added. "There has been a sudden increase in the moisture levels over central and western Maharashtra regions, including Pune," an IMD official said. Pune on Sunday recorded 78 mm of rainfall.

25.title: 6 people killed, 19 injured in Russia after warplane hits building
25.article_body: At least six people were killed and 19 others were injured after a Russian warplane crashed into a residential building in Russia's Yeysk town near Ukraine border on Monday after suffering engine failure, Russian news agencies said. Some of the victims died after they jumped from the upper floors of the nine-storey building to escape a massive blaze, authorities said.

26.title: Raids in Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Delhi-NCR against terrorists and gangsters
26.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday conducted raids at more than 40 locations in Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Delhi-NCR region. The searches were conducted to dismantle the emerging nexus between terrorists, gangsters and drug smugglers based in India and abroad. The gangsters were reportedly planning to carry out acts of terror.

27.title: Drunk man bites flight attendant's finger, punches him in Istanbul flight; video surfaces
27.article_body: An Istanbul-Jakarta Turkish Airlines flight was forced to make an emergency landing after a drunk passenger got into a fight with flight attendants. The passenger identified as a pilot of different carrier bit a flight attendant's finger. A video showing the passenger punching a flight attendant is being widely circulated on social media.

28.title: SL's Shehan Karunatilaka wins £50,000 Booker Prize for 'The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida'
28.article_body: Sri Lankan author Shehan Karunatilaka won the 2022 Booker Prize for Fiction for his novel 'The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida'. The book centers around the killing of a war photographer in Colombo in the 1990s and explores life after death amid a Sri Lanka beset by civil war. Karunatilaka bagged a prize money of £50,000.

29.title: Pic of Scotland bowler looking at a note while bowling in T20 World Cup 2022 goes viral
29.article_body: A picture of Scotland spinner Mark Watt looking at a note while bowling during his team's T20 World Cup 2022 match against West Indies has gone viral on social media. The 26-year-old, who recorded bowling figures of 4-0-12-3 in his team's victory, later took to Twitter to reveal what was written on the note. "Don't bowl slot," the note read.

30.title: Man dies after he hits speed breaker, falls from bike in Pune
30.article_body: A 46-year-old man died when he fell from his bike after hitting a speed breaker on the Katraj-Dehu Road bypass in Pune. The deceased may have failed to see the speed breaker as it wasn't properly marked, according to police. A sub-inspector said that the deceased suffered head injuries and died on the spot. The incident took place last week.

31.title: Bus crushes B'luru woman's legs as she falls off scooter due to pothole
31.article_body: A 50-year-old woman's legs were crushed by a bus after she fell off a scooter while her daughter, who was driving the vehicle, tried to evade a pothole in Bengaluru. The woman also suffered injuries on her head and abdomen. Reports said that the road was up for repairs but could not be repaired due to heavy rainfall.

32.title: Pic of leopard eel's CT scan shared by US zoo goes viral
32.article_body: Picture of a leopard eel's CT scan which was shared by US' Point Defiance Zoo and Aquarium has gone viral on social media. "Zoo Veterinarian, Dr Kadie, identified a mass in the eel's mouth that was likely due to a broken tooth," the zoo wrote. Reacting to the picture, a social media user said, "I thought it was an art."

33.title: Billionaire Louis Vuitton CEO sells private jet after people track it on Twitter
33.article_body:
Bernard Arnault, the CEO of LVMH and the world's second-richest person, revealed that the luxury-goods company sold their private jet after people set up Twitter accounts tracking their flights.
The 73-year-old billionaire said he has now been renting private jets. Arnault has an estimated net worth of $137 billion, as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

34.title: 27-year-old man stabbed to death over argument in Delhi, 2 arrested
34.article_body: Police arrested two men for allegedly stabbing to death a 27-year-old man following a heated argument in Delhi's Chirag Delhi area. The two accused worked as domestic help in south Delhi, and one of the accused was apprehended within five hours, police said. The second accused was arrested at New Delhi Railway Station, police added.

35.title: Woman's naked body found stuffed in suitcase in Gurugram; FIR filed
35.article_body: An FIR has been filed after the naked body of an unidentified woman was found stuffed in a suitcase near IFFCO Chowk in Gurugram on Monday, police said. "A preliminary probe has found that the woman was murdered elsewhere and her body was...dumped here," DCP (West) Deepak Saharan said. He added that efforts are underway to identify the deceased.

36.title: No water supply for 24 hours in parts of Mumbai today
36.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has announced a 24-hour water supply cut in parts of Mumbai today. The water supply will be disconnected from 10 pm on October 17 to 10 pm on October 18. The supply will be hit because of the cross connection work of newly laid 750 mm water main with existing 600 mm dia, BMC said.

37.title: 'Jee Le Zaraa' is super exciting, we're all looking forward to it: Katrina
37.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said her upcoming film 'Jee Le Zaraa' with Priyanka Chopra and Alia Bhatt is a "super exciting film" and they are "all looking forward to it". "That film has had its journey...but I think when finally it does happen, it's gonna be a lot of fun," she added. 'Jee Le Zaraa' was announced in 2021.

38.title: Karim Benzema wins Ballon d'Or for the first time ever
38.article_body: Real Madrid and France forward Karim Benzema won the Ballon d'Or for the first time ever. The 34-year-old scored 44 goals in 46 appearances for Real Madrid last season and won the La Liga and Champions League with the Spanish club. Benzema is the fifth French player to win the Ballon d'Or and the first since Zinedine Zidane in 1998.

39.title: Former Infosys President Ravi Kumar S to join Cognizant to lead its Americas market
39.article_body: Former Infosys President Ravi Kumar S, who resigned from Infosys last week, will join Cognizant on January 16, 2023, as President of Cognizant Americas. He will also be joining Cognizant's executive committee and will be based in New York, as per reports. Kumar has over 20 years of experience in the consulting, process and technology transformation space.

40.title: J&K group protesting Kashmiri Pandit killing remove Hurriyat board
40.article_body: A group protesting against the killing of a Kashmiri Pandit by terrorists removed the signboard of the All Parties Hurriyat Conference at Rajbagh in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian. The protestors also threatened to hold protests outside the Pakistan Embassy in New Delhi. "They (Hurriyat) have been only doing lip service...They should have held protests against these killings," said a protestor.

41.title: Reb Bull in a favourable position for 2023 season: Mercedes F1 boss
41.article_body: Mercedes F1 CEO Toto Wolff said Red Bull will be "in a very favourable position" at the beginning of the 2023 season. "We have missed a lot of development time to find out about bouncing and porpoising...I think we can catch up quickly," said Wolff. "There is no team (in any sport) that is winning every single championship," he added.

42.title: Qatar to host AFC Asian Cup 2023; India, Saudi Arabia shortlisted for 2027
42.article_body: After hosting the 2022 FIFA World Cup, Qatar will host the Asian Cup 2023, said the Asian Football Confederation (AFC). The All India Football Federation and the Saudi Arabian Football Federation have also been selected as the final two bidders for the tournament's 2027 edition. A decision on the same host for 2027 will be taken in February 2023.

43.title: Army issues tenders for 363 high & medium-altitude logistic drones
43.article_body: The Indian Army has issued initial tenders for the procurement of 363 drones to "boost its logistics chain and enhance operational preparedness". While 163 drones would be for high-altitude regions, 200 will be for medium-altitude areas. Medium-altitude drones should be able to carry at least 20 kg of payload, while high-altitude drones should carry 15 kg, the proposal said.

44.title: Bumrah a big loss, Shami seems a good replacement: Sachin Tendulkar
44.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar said Indian pacer Mohammad Shami "seems a good replacement" for the injured Jasprit Bumrah in T20 World Cup 2022. "Bumrah not being there is a big loss and we obviously needed a strike bowler...who could attack batters and get wickets," said Tendulkar. He added a captain should pick spinners during T20 World Cup based on ground dimensions.

45.title: Teams overspending are effectively cheating: McLaren F1 CEO to FIA
45.article_body: McLaren F1 CEO Zak Brown told the FIA that teams that breach the sport’s cost cap are “effectively cheating”. “Bottom line is any team who has overspent has gained an unfair advantage...in the current and following year’s car development,” said Brown. The FIA have found that Red Bull breached the 2021 cost cap set for them.

46.title: Fighter jet crashes into apartment building in southern Russia
46.article_body: A Russian Sukhoi Su-34 crashed into a nine-storey apartment building in the southern Russian city of Yeysk on Monday, the regional governor said. The crash caused a fire in the building that "engulfed several floors at once", the governor of the Krasnodar region added. The fighter jet crashed during a training flight from a military airfield, news agency RIA reported.

47.title: Goal this year to take a catch that could go down as one of my best: Hardik
47.article_body: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that his goal for 2022 is to take a catch that can be considered one of his all-time best. "I am able to spend a lot of time on my fielding with our coach (T Dilip). I was always natural as a fielder, but I want to be exceptional," Pandya said.

48.title: What a year she has had: Navratilova after Swiatek's 8th title of 2022
48.article_body: Eighteen-time Grand Slam champion Martina Navratilova took to Twitter after world number one Iga Swiatek won her eighth title of 2022 and wrote, "What a year Iga has had!!!" The 21-year-old Pole's eight titles this year include two Grand Slams (French Open, US Open), four WTA 1000s (Doha, Indian Wells, Miami, Rome) and two WTA 500s (Stuttgart, San Diego).

49.title: 3 masked men shoot cashier, run away with cash in Rajasthan
49.article_body: Three masked men fired at a bank cashier before robbing him of ₹4 lakh in the Sapotra block of Rajasthan's Karauli district on Monday. The three unidentified accused had come on a bike and were carrying country-made pistols, police said. The bank management has registered a case against the accused who are being identified through CCTV footage, police added.

50.title: CBI denies Sisodia's claims that he was asked to quit AAP for BJP during questioning
50.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Monday issued a statement refusing Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's allegations that he was asked to leave AAP and join BJP during questioning in the Delhi excise policy scam case. "CBI...reiterates that his examination was carried out in a professional and legal manner," the statement read. Sisodia claimed he was offered Delhi CM's post.

51.title: Pity it took so long for us to play in a World Cup: Zimbabwe captain
51.article_body: Zimbabwe captain Craig Ervine said it is "a pity" that it took "so long" for the team to play in a World Cup match. "To put in a performance like that in the first game back in the World Cup, we showed we belong," said Ervine, after his team defeated Ireland. Zimbabwe last featured in the 2016 T20 World Cup.

52.title: Switch to survival mindset: Suniel Shetty after Byju's fires 2,500 employees
52.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty reacted to Byju's firing 2,500 employees in a cost-cutting measure and said, "[It] was a tough one to swallow." Saying that the layoffs likely affected 10,000 people, Shetty, without naming the company, said, "This is a good time for early-stage...businesses to establish a few operating principles...If you're not seeing growth, switch to a survival mindset."

53.title: Special to be back where it all changed for me: Neeraj at Thank you Tokyo event
53.article_body: After attending the 'Thank you Tokyo!' event, Tokyo Olympics gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra tweeted, "Had a great time at the Tokyo 2020 commemoration ceremony today." "And [it] was a special feeling being back at the stadium where it all changed for me," he added. The event commemorated the successful hosting of the Tokyo 2020 Olympics last year.

54.title: Rahul should stop Bharat Jodo Yatra & concentrate on Himachal, Guj: Cong MP
54.article_body: Congress MP Francisco Sardinha said Rahul Gandhi should stop the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and concentrate on the poll-bound states of Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. He added that Congress is the "only party" which can defeat the BJP. The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is very important, said Sardinha, adding that he now wants Rahul 'to stop immediately'.

55.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh meets African counterparts
55.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday held discussions with his counterparts from Ethiopia, Mauritania, Gambia, Ghana and the Central African Republic ahead of the India-Africa Defence Dialogue which is scheduled for Tuesday. The dialogue will be held on the sidelines of DefExpo 2022 in Gandhinagar, the Defence Ministry said. The first India-Africa Defence Dialogue was held in Lucknow in 2020.

56.title: PVR reports wider than expected Q2 loss at ₹71 crore
56.article_body: Multiplex operator PVR announced that it has reported a bigger-than-expected net loss of ₹71.23 crore for the quarter that ended September. PVR, in its exchange filings, said admissions and average ticket prices suffered due to the weak performance of Bollywood and Hollywood movies. Revenue from operations jumped 470.7% on year to ₹687 crore, but slumped 30% from the previous quarter.

57.title: V-Mart acquires e-commerce startup LimeRoad in a ₹31-crore deal
57.article_body: Fashion retailer V-Mart Retail said it is set to acquire e-commerce startup LimeRoad for lump sum cash of around ₹31.12 crore. The company, in its regulatory filing, said it plans to invest ₹150 crore to scale and achieve sustained profitability. According to the filings, LimeRoad clocked net revenue of ₹179.95 crore in 2019-2020 which dropped to ₹69 crore in 2021-2022.

58.title: T20 has extended life of a professional cricketer: Ex-Aus coach
58.article_body: Former World Cup-winning coach John Buchanan said that the T20 format has extended the life of a cricketer. "I was there for the Legends League Cricket," Buchanan said. The Australian added, "That (veteran leagues) in itself creates more interest on the basis that you can play T20 now for a long period of time and still return [with] reasonable money."

59.title: If Cong gets united, then only India will get united: Mani Shankar Aiyar
59.article_body: Former Union Minister Mani Shankar Aiyar said that if the Congress gets united, then only India will get united. "All these questions, that...who will become the PM, all these can be answered when the right time comes," Aiyar said. He added, "But today, we need to unite the Congress, and... 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is the first step."

60.title: Piramal Pharma to list shares on October 19
60.article_body: According to a BSE notice, the equity shares of Piramal Pharma Limited shall be listed and admitted to dealings on the exchange in the list of T Group of Securities on October 19. The shares would be listed at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma was demerged from Piramal Enterprises to simplify the company's corporate structure.

61.title: UP govt offers rebate on land stamp duty for setting up new textile units
61.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Rakesh Sachan said under the new Handloom and Textile Industry Policy-2022, entrepreneurs will get a 25% rebate on the purchase of land. The government will also offer up to 100% exemption from stamp duty for setting up a textile unit in the state. The minister said that it aimed at attracting ₹10,000 crore in private investment.

62.title: OFI Global, other funds to sell 5.29 crore equity shares in Zee: Report
62.article_body: OFI Global China Fund and other Invesco-managed funds are reportedly planning to sell 5.29 crore equity shares held in Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd. The deal size represents around 5.51 percent of the total shares outstanding in the company. The price for the deal was reported to be in the range of ₹250 to ₹263.7 per share.

63.title: India crash out of 2022 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup after conceding 16 goals, scoring 0
63.article_body: Hosts India have crashed out of 2022 FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup after conceding 16 goals and scoring 0 in the group stage. India lost to Brazil 0-5 today after having lost to USA 0-8 and to Morocco 0-3. USA and Brazil have advanced to the next stage of the tournament from India's group.

64.title: Mohammad Shami meets Shaheen Afridi, gives him bowling tips; pics go viral
64.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami met Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi and gave him bowling tips in Brisbane. Videos and pictures of their interaction has gone viral. In a video, Shaheen can be heard saying, "I'm following you since I started bowling and from that time I've been a big fan of your wrist position and upright seam."

65.title: 21 Indian wrestlers to miss U-23 World Championship after visa rejection by Spain Embassy
65.article_body: The embassy of Spain has denied visas to 21 Indian wrestlers, who were to compete at the U-23 World Championship in Pontevedra, on suspicion that they will not leave the territory before the expiry of visas. The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) had picked a 30-member squad for the Championship, that began on Monday, but only nine were granted visas.

66.title: Replacing 'phone banking' with 'digital banking' promoted growth: PM
66.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said India's sustained economic growth has been possible due to the BJP government's efforts to replace pre-2014 'phone banking' with 'digital banking'. Under 'phone banking', instructions were given to banks on phones, PM Modi said. Any country's economy is as progressive as its banking sector's strength, he added.

67.title: Germany starts programme to take in Afghans deemed most at-risk
67.article_body: The German government on Monday launched a programme to take in Afghan citizens who are considered to be at a high risk of facing persecution under Taliban rule. Under the programme, 1,000 Afghans and their family members will be admitted to Germany every month. The programme targets individuals associated with women's and human rights advocacy, politics, justice and other fields.

68.title: Roche Pharma sets up data analytics center in Hyderabad, 2nd in India
68.article_body: Swiss multinational healthcare company Roche Pharma has set up a state-of-the-art Global Analytics and Technology Centre of Excellence (GATE) in Hyderabad. The centre, reportedly India's second, will work with the global affiliates of Roche to advance knowledge and understanding of the healthcare space. Meanwhile, Telangana Minister KTR said, "I'm delighted to welcome Roche Pharma to Hyderabad."

69.title: Who is Abdul Kardar, the new inductee in PCB Hall of Fame who has played for India too?
69.article_body: Abdul Hafeez Kardar has been inducted into Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Hall of Fame. He's Pakistan's first-ever captain. He was born in Lahore on January 17, 1925 and made his Test debut for India in 1946. He played three Tests for India, scoring 80 runs. After Partition, he represented Pakistan in 23 Tests, scoring 847 runs and taking 21 wickets.

70.title: Man kills sleeping stray dog by hitting brick on its head in UP, video surfaces
70.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man killing a sleeping stray dog by hitting a brick on its head in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The Uttar Pradesh Police took cognisance of the viral video and arrested the accused for animal cruelty. "This kind of inhuman act is unforgivable," the police said.

71.title: Fake CBI began 'raids' on Mumbai businessmen during demonetisation
71.article_body: Goregaon Police said the gang posing as CBI officers to rob businessmen began their racket during demonetisation. They would collect information on those who wanted their money converted and "raid" them. Police said they are looking into more victims after one businessman recently came forward about being kidnapped and robbed of ₹50 lakh by the gang in July.

72.title: Govt school teacher suspended for sexually abusing student in Assam
72.article_body: A government school teacher was suspended for allegedly sexually abusing a student on the premises of the institute in Assam's Kamrup district, an official said on Monday. A police case has been registered against the accused, the official added. A show cause notice was served to the teacher by Kamrup Inspector of Schools Apurba Thakuria on October 14.

73.title: Once you get used to Australian conditions, you can get lot of runs: Hardik
73.article_body: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that he was always excited to come to Australia and get so much time to prepare for the T20 World Cup. "In Australia, it's about one inning. If you can get the inning early in the season, once you get used to the conditions, you can score a lot of runs," Pandya said.

74.title: US woman saves for 30 years to fund her ₹2 cr trip to see the Titanic's wreckage
74.article_body: An American woman named Renata Rojas saved money for over 30 years to fund her trip to see the wreckage of the Titanic ship which sank in 1912. Renata spent $250,000 (around ₹2 crore) for the trip to the bottom of the North Atlantic Ocean to see the remains of the ship which sank 110 years ago.

75.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Yashoda' to release on November 11
75.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu on Monday announced the release date of her movie 'Yashoda'. The film will be released on November 11. It will arrive in theatres in multiple languages, including Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam, Kannada and Hindi. 'Yashoda' has been directed by Haresh Narayan and K Hari Shankar.

76.title: No Kejriwal to tutor Sisodia during CBI questioning: Amit Malviya
76.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya said Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia needs to be reminded that "he has been summoned for corruption and is not going for Satyagrah". Malviya added that Sisodia has to face the CBI alone and "there will be no Kejriwal to tutor" him. He said Rahul Gandhi too had thrown "similar tantrums" but still recorded his statements.

77.title: You gave me company when I faced a tough time as child: Arjun to Sanjay Kapoor
77.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram on Monday to wish his uncle Sanjay Kapoor on the occasion of his birthday. In a video message, Arjun said, "You've given me company when I faced a tough time as...child." "I...want to thank you from the bottom of my heart, for being such a positive person, who's so full of life," he added.

78.title: Germany fines Telegram $5 mn for not establishing way to report content
78.article_body: Telegram has been fined $5 million by Germany for not establishing a lawful way for reporting illegal content and not naming an entity in Germany to receive official communication. Officials said they've repeatedly failed in their attempts to serve papers to Dubai-based Telegram, despite support from UAE authorities. Telegram is becoming "medium for radicalisation", German police had said earlier.

79.title: Fill up 14 lakh vacant posts in govt depts, PSUs: CPI to Centre
79.article_body: The Communist Party of India has demanded that the Centre immediately fill about 14 lakh vacant posts in the Central government departments and the public sector undertakings. In a resolution passed at its 24th national congress at Vijayawada on Monday, the CPI alleged that over two crore youths of the country are unemployed and seeking jobs.

80.title: Govt to invite proposals under second phase of PLI scheme for solar sector
80.article_body: New & Renewable Energy Secretary Indu Shekhar Chaturvedi said government will invite proposals under second phase of ₹19,500-crore production linked incentive (PLI-II) scheme for solar sector within a week. Chaturvedi added that by 2026, India is looking at the capacities of 38 GW in Polysilicons, 56 GW in Ingot and Wafers, 70-80 GW in cells and 90-100 GW in modules.

81.title: We need to wake up: WI head coach Simmons on team's loss vs Scotland
81.article_body: West Indies head coach Phil Simmons said his side's batting was "a bit unprofessional" in their 42-run defeat against Scotland in T20 World Cup 2022. "We need to wake up...start being as professional as we can be," he added. Chasing 161, West Indies were bowled out for 118 in 18.3 overs as only four of their batters reached double digits.

82.title: Indian cyclist Ronaldo creates national record in 200m flying time trial
82.article_body: Indian cyclist Ronaldo Singh Laitonjam created a new national record in men's 200m flying time trial category in the recently concluded Cycling Track World Championships 2022 in France. He clocked 9.91 seconds in the men's sprint qualifying round. Finishing at the 31st place, Ronaldo couldn't qualify as only the top 28 made it to the next round.

83.title: Was asked to leave AAP: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia after 9-hour CBI questioning
83.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who was questioned by CBI in Delhi excise policy scam case for nearly nine hours on Monday, said, "I was asked to leave AAP or else such cases will keep getting registered against me." He added, "I said I won't leave AAP for BJP." Sisodia alleged he was told that he'll be made the CM.

84.title: Beauty: Anushka on Kohli's 1-handed catch vs Aus in T20 WC warm-up match
84.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram Stories and reacted to her husband and cricketer Virat Kohli taking a one-handed catch versus Australia during the T20 World Cup warm-up match. Sharing the video of the catch, the actress wrote, "Beauty!" Australia lost by six runs in the warm-up match after India took four wickets in the last four deliveries.

85.title: EU approves training mission for Ukrainian soldiers
85.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Monday approved a military assistance mission to train 15,000 Ukrainian soldiers in the wake of the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. The mission will initially run for two years with a budget of almost $104 million, the Associated Press reported. The bloc also approved military aid worth $486 million for the purchase of weapons by Kyiv.

86.title: Cement maker ACC posts loss of ₹91 crore in Q3; sales grow 7%
86.article_body: Cement manufacturer ACC has reported a standalone loss of ₹91 crore for the quarter ended September 2022. The company recorded a 7% rise in net sales at ₹3,910 crore as compared to ₹3,653 crore it reported in the same quarter last year. Notably, Gautam Adani-led Adani Group has recently acquired ACC along with Ambuja Cements from Switzerland's Holcim.

87.title: Gavaskar gifts Babar 'Sunny' cap at dinner party hosted by Hayden, PCB shares video
87.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) shared a video showing Sunil Gavaskar meeting Pakistan captain Babar Azam at a dinner party hosted by Pakistan's batting mentor Matthew Hayden at his house in Brisbane. In the video, Gavaskar can be seen presenting 'Sunny' cap to Babar. He can also be seen signing the cap for Babar.

88.title: Katrina Kaif to play double role in 'Phone Bhoot': Reports
88.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif will reportedly be seen in a double role in the upcoming film 'Phone Bhoot'. Directed by Gurmmeet Singh, it is a horror-comedy film which will also feature Ishaan Khatter, Siddhant Chaturvedi, Jackie Shroff and Sheeba Chadha, among others. 'Phone Bhoot' is set to release in theatres on November 4.

89.title: 2 UN peacekeepers killed, 4 injured in IED blast in Mali
89.article_body: Two UN peacekeepers were killed and four were seriously injured when their vehicle hit an IED in northern Mali on Monday, UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA said. The peacekeepers were on a mine detection patrol in the Kidal region when the incident occurred, MINUSMA added. Northern Mali has a strong presence of militant groups linked to al-Qaeda and the Islamic State.

90.title: Video of Babar, Kohli practising in parallel nets in Brisbane goes viral
90.article_body: A video of Pakistan captain Babar Azam and former India captain Virat Kohli practising in parallel nets in Brisbane ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 has gone viral. Kohli went straight into the nets after India's victory against Australia in their warm-up match. Kohli scored 19 runs off 13 deliveries in the match, including a four and a six.

91.title: Tina Datta was trying to backstab me on 'Bigg Boss 16': Sreejita De
91.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Sreejita De, who became the first contestant to be evicted from the show, has said that co-contestant and actress Tina Datta was trying to backstab her on the show. "Now that I'm out, I get to see that she...was trying to manipulate her friends against me...She was talking bad about me behind my back," Sreejita added.

92.title: Liverpool pledge to impose life ban on fans who threw coins at Guardiola
92.article_body: Liverpool FC have pledged to impose life ban on the club's supporters found guilty of throwing coins towards Pep Guardiola during Sunday's Premier League match against Manchester City at Anfield. "This is totally unacceptable behaviour and not the standards of behaviour we expect at Anfield," said a club spokesman. Guardiola had said he did not get hit by the coins.

93.title: Deepika in talks to star in Rajamouli's next film with Mahesh Babu: Reports
93.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone is reportedly in talks to play the female lead in filmmaker SS Rajamouli's next film, which will feature Mahesh Babu as the male lead. The yet-untitled film will reportedly go on the floors in the first half of 2023. Deepika will also be seen in 'Pathaan', 'Fighter', 'Project K' and 'The Intern'.

94.title: Karnataka High Court stays counselling for NEET PG 2022
94.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Monday stayed the counselling process for NEET Postgraduate Entrance Test (PGET) 2022 till further notice. Details about the commencement of the Karnataka counselling will be announced soon and the Karnataka High Court will hear the matter now on October 30. Registrations for the counselling began on October 14.

95.title: Hrithik delayed 'Vikram Vedha' shoot for me due to 'Mismatched 2': Rohit Saraf
95.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' actor Rohit Saraf said Hrithik Roshan intervened after the shoot dates of the film and Rohit's web series 'Mismatched 2' were clashing. He added 'Mismatched' director Akarsh Khurana adjusted shoot dates after a talk with Hrithik. "But...Hrithik understood we couldn't cancel...schedule of 'Mismatched'...entire schedule of 'Vikram Vedha' got pushed by five days," Rohit stated.

96.title: 11 convicts in Bilkis Bano case granted bail for good behaviour: Guj govt to SC
96.article_body: The 11 men convicted in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case were released on grounds of "good behaviour", the Gujarat government told the Supreme Court on Monday. The state government has filed an affidavit defending its decision to grant remission to the convicts, who were sentenced to life imprisonment. Bilkis' three-year-old daughter was among 14 killed by a mob in 2002.

97.title: Bitterly disappointed: Balbirnie after Ireland's loss vs Zimbabwe in T20 WC
97.article_body: Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie said his side is "bitterly disappointed" with the way they started their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign after losing to Zimbabwe by 31 runs in Group B match on Monday. "It's a pretty straightforward shoot-out for us now," he added. Chasing a target of 175 runs, Ireland managed to score 143/9 in 20 overs.

98.title: Qatar World Cup ticket sales near 3 million mark: FIFA President
98.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino said that 2.89 million tickets have been sold up till now for the upcoming football World Cup in Qatar and the figure is soon likely to touch the three million mark. Almost 240,000 hospitality packages had been sold for the tournament, Infantino said. The top three purchasing countries are Qatar, the United States and Saudi Arabia.

99.title: Wild bear sighted near T'gana university campus, search op underway
99.article_body: Telangana Forest Department officials have started a search operation to locate a wild bear that was reportedly sighted near the men's hostel of Satavahana University in Telangana's Karimnagar on Sunday night. Meanwhile, students have reportedly been asked not to venture out in the evenings. The campus security guards who keep vigil at night have been asked to move in groups.

100.title: India's retail inflation set to ease from 5-month high in September: RBI
100.article_body: The RBI, in its monthly bulletin, said that retail inflation is set to ease after it hit a five-month high in September. RBI added that the fight against inflation will be "dogged and prolonged", given the long and variable lags of monetary policies. It said the expected easing in inflation would likely be "driven by the food and beverages".

101.title: Flights rescheduled as Mumbai airport to remain closed between 11 am & 5 pm tomorrow
101.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport will be closed between 11 am and 5 pm on Tuesday due to annual repair and maintenance work on both its runways. The airport has rescheduled flights accordingly. Major work like runway edge lights and the upgradation of Aeronautical ground lights will be carried out during this time period.

102.title: Raza played exceptionally well: Ervine on Zimbabwe's win vs Ireland in T20 WC
102.article_body: Zimbabwe skipper Craig Ervine lauded Sikandar Raza, saying his teammate played exceptionally well against Ireland in T20 World Cup 2022 Group B match. "He's been a solid performer for us over the last few months. So excited that he could bring that form here again," he added. Raza was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in Zimbabwe's 31-run win.

103.title: Apple's VR headset to let users log in, make payments biometrically: Report
103.article_body: Apple's virtual reality XR headset will include sensors that work like Face ID and offer iris-scanning technology, according to reports. The new technology, called 'Iris ID', would enable users to log in to their accounts and make payments biometrically. The headset reportedly has over 10 cameras and might be powered by M2 chip, same as that used in MacBook Air.

104.title: RBI fines 3 Gujarat-based cooperative banks for rule violations
104.article_body: RBI has fined three Gujarat-based banks for violating regulatory norms. RBI has reportedly imposed a monetary penalty of ₹25,000 on Meghraj Nagarik Sahakari Bank, ₹50,000 on Gandhidham Mercantile Co-operative Bank and ₹2 lakh on Co-operative Bank of Rajkot. The banks had individually sanctioned loans, wherein directors' relatives stood as surety or guarantors, violating RBI's regulatory norms.

105.title: Makers share pic from 'Pushpa 2' sets, Rashmika Mandanna reacts
105.article_body: Mythri Movie Makers, the producers of Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Pushpa' franchise, shared a picture from the sets of 'Pushpa: The Rule' on Twitter. Along with the picture, they tweeted, "Icon star Allu, director Sukumar, celebrity photographer Avinash Gowariker...the entire team is putting all their efforts to deliver the best." Rashmika tweeted, "Look at that! It's starting y'all."

106.title: Hacker who stole $100 mn from DeFi app Mango gets to keep $50 mn
106.article_body: A hacker who stole about $100 million from decentralised-finance (DeFi) application Mango got to keep around $50 million of the funds in various crypto assets after returning the rest on Saturday. The hacker had demanded erasure of bad debts. Mango's team then offered to let the hacker keep $50 million while promising no criminal prosecution and erasure of bad debt.

107.title: Beating Magnus Carlsen is special, but not very proud of that game: 16-year-old Gukesh D
107.article_body: After 16-year-old Grandmaster Gukesh D became the youngest chess player to defeat Magnus Carlsen after the latter became world champion, Gukesh said, "Beating Magnus is always special...but I am not very proud of that game." Carlsen said, "Gukesh has been extremely impressive in classical chess...Perhaps this rapid win wasn't his proudest effort, even though getting a win is always nice."

108.title: 4 more terror suspects with links to al-Qaeda arrested in Assam
108.article_body: Assam Police on Monday arrested four persons with alleged links to Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT), a Bangladesh-based terror outfit affiliated with al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma, announcing the arrests, said, "We're determined to root out jihadi elements from Assam." "Arrest of Sadeq Ali is a significant achievement since he had been radicalising youth," he added.

109.title: Journalist who protested Ukraine war on live TV flees Russia
109.article_body: Former Russian state TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who was placed under house arrest for spreading "fake news" about the war in Ukraine, has fled the country, her lawyer said on Monday. Ovsyannikova announced her escape from house arrest in an online post on October 5. She had staged an on-air protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine in March.

110.title: Afghan woman kills self before Taliban could stone her for eloping with married man
110.article_body: An Afghan woman, who was to be stoned to death by the Taliban for running away with a married man, died by suicide to reportedly avoid public humiliation, local media said. The man she ran away with was reportedly executed on Thursday. The woman was sentenced to be publicly stoned due to the lack of women's prisons, said a report.

111.title: Vegetable seller objects to man drinking alcohol in Agra, stabbed
111.article_body: A 32-year-old vegetable vendor was stabbed to death in Agra after he objected to a man drinking alcohol near his cart, police said on Monday. The 26-year-old accused took a sharp object from the cart and stabbed the vendor in his chest on Sunday, police said. The victim was taken to the hospital but was declared dead later, police added.

112.title: Trolls, where are you all slowly vanishing, don't leave me: Raj Kundra
112.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra tweeted, "Trolls, where are you all slowly vanishing, please don't leave me." Recently, Raj completed one year of being released from jail in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps. Several Twitter users reacted to Raj's post. One of the users wrote, "This tweet is also going to be deleted."

113.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who abused & assaulted Noida woman, gets bail
113.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has granted bail to politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted a woman at a Noida residential society in August. Tyagi was granted bail in some cases but remained in jail. Among other cases, he was booked under the Gangster Act after a group of his supporters stormed the society and sought the woman complainant's address.

114.title: A small film is breaking records of biggies: RGV on 'Kantara'
114.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to praise Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara'. "Just when all filmwallas came to the conclusion that only superstars, massive production values and spectacular VFX can bring people to theatres, a small tiny film with no names, #Kantara is breaking all...records of the biggies," he wrote. The film has collected over ₹100 crore globally.

115.title: Suryakumar is very different from Kohli and Karthik: Gambhir
115.article_body: Speaking about Suryakumar Yadav, Gautam Gambhir stated that the Team India batter is very different from teammates Virat Kohli and Dinesh Karthik. "He (Suryakumar) is extremely unorthodox, plays shots over fine leg, third man, cover...Karthik...improvises a lot...Kohli likes to take his time while batting," he added. Suryakumar scored a 33-ball 50 against Australia in T20 World Cup warm-up match.

116.title: Kerala human sacrifice accused may have used mortuary experience: Police
116.article_body: The key accused of torturing and killing two women as 'human sacrifice' in Kerala may have used his mortuary experience to cut the bodies, police said. The accused had worked as a helper at the post-mortem table around 20 years ago. The women were killed on different days between June and September.

117.title: Deeply concerning: UK on attack on protester at Chinese consulate
117.article_body: The British PM's office on Monday said the reports of an apparent assault on a protester inside the grounds of the Chinese consulate in Manchester were "deeply concerning". The protester was seemingly dragged into the consular grounds and assaulted by several men, according to a video shared online. The incident occurred during a demonstration against Chinese President Xi Jinping.

118.title: Ladakh administration gifts cricket kit to young Virat Kohli fan after her video goes viral
118.article_body: The Ladakh administration gifted a cricket kit to a Class 6 girl named Masuma Banoo from Kaksar Kargil after her video playing cricket went viral on social media. In the video, the girl had stated that Virat Kohli is her favourite cricketer and she wants to bat like him. The administration also shared a video wherein Masuma expressed her gratitude.

119.title: She is & will always be the most beautiful actress: Bhansali on Hema Malini
119.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said in an interview that he is a huge fan of Hema Malini, adding that she is and will always be "the most beautiful actress ever". "[Earlier] movies were bought by distributors solely because of her presence," he said. "It didn't matter who the hero was if Hemaji was in a film," Bhansali further said.

120.title: Salman Khan, Anil Kapoor & Fardeen Khan's 'No Entry 2' shelved: Reports
120.article_body: Salman Khan-starrer 'No Entry 2' has reportedly been shelved over legal and financial issues. According to a source, the plan was to pay off everyone and acquire the rights to the 2005 film, which was produced by now-closed Sahara One Motion Pictures. However, the amount has reportedly exceeded the budget. "Circumstances are such that nothing is materializing," the source added.

121.title: Woman fights robbers, foils robbery attempt in Raj; video surfaces
121.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, a female Gramin Bank employee can be seen fighting robbers and thwarting a robbery bid in Rajasthan's Sri Ganganagar area. The robber allegedly barged into the bank with a knife and threatened the officials. In the video, the woman can be seen picking up an electrical instrument to fight the robbers.

122.title: Justice DY Chandrachud appointed Chief Justice of India from November 9 onward
122.article_body: Justice DY Chandrachud was on Monday appointed the 50th Chief Justice of India (CJI) by President Droupadi Murmu, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said. Chandrachud, a law graduate from Delhi University, will take oath on November 9. The current Justice UU Lalit, who is due to retire on November 8, recommended Chandrachud as his successor last week.

123.title: 5 including 4 of Haryana family dead, 3 hurt in car-truck collision
123.article_body: Four members of a family died after the car they were travelling in collided head-on with a truck coming from the opposite direction in Haryana's Hisar district, police said on Monday. Because of the collision, two motorcycles were also hit and one of the riders died, police added. At least three persons sustained injuries in the accident.

124.title: MP doctor writes prescription in Hindi with 'Shri Hari', pics surface
124.article_body: A prescription written in Hindi by a government doctor in Madhya Pradesh has surfaced on social media. The doctor, Sarvesh Singh, also wrote 'Shri Hari' on the top of the prescription. This comes after Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that doctors could perhaps start writing prescriptions in Hindi with 'Shri Hari' on top.

125.title: Without late director Nishikant, Drishyam 2 wasn't possible: Ajay Devgn
125.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn remembered late director Nishikant Kamat, who had directed 'Drishyam', at the trailer launch event of 'Drishyam 2'. "I want to just take this occasion to remember Nishi, who directed the first part. Without him, this wasn't possible," he stated. Nishikant, who was diagnosed with cirrhosis, passed away aged 50 in 2020.

126.title: AAP 'glorifying' corruption, says BJP after Sisodia's 'roadshow'
126.article_body: BJP on Monday accused AAP of "glorifying corruption", alleging that Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia held a roadshow despite being complicit in the excise policy scam. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said he was hurt when he saw Sisodia being garlanded and being taken to Rajghat in an open car. AAP converting a vice into a victory, Patra said.

127.title: 3 J'khand teenagers die, another hurt as portion of land caves in
127.article_body: Three teenagers died after a portion of land caved in when they were extracting soil for painting their hut's walls for Diwali in Jharkhand's Chatra district, police said. Four teenagers, who were left buried after the incident, were retrieved with the help of villagers and an excavator. They were rushed to a health sub-centre, where three of them died.

128.title: Here to be serious actress, not girl who only does dance numbers: AvrRam
128.article_body: Actress Elli AvrRam, speaking about being an outsider and a foreigner in the film industry, said she's in a "constant struggle" to prove she's a serious actress, not the girl who only does dance numbers. "But I'm happy where I'm today and I'm really grateful to all the people who gave me an opportunity to showcase my talent," she added.

129.title: You'll not see this sort of batting in every game: Gambhir on KL Rahul's 57
129.article_body: Praising KL Rahul following his 33-ball 57 in India's T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match against Australia, Gautam Gambhir said, "You will not see this sort of batting in every match." He added that Rahul, who hit six fours and three sixes during his knock, was seen in "exceptional" rhythm. India won the match by six runs.

130.title: Delhi LG issues notice to DDC VC Jasmine Shah over misuse of public office
130.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena on Monday issued a show cause notice to Dialogue and Development Commission's Vice Chairperson Jasmine Shah over allegations of "misuse of public office". The notice has been sent following a complaint by BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh. "Shah...acted as official spokesperson of AAP for political gains, which is in violation of established procedures," LG's notice read.

131.title: 2 Chinese nationals arrested for cyber fraud in Greater Noida
131.article_body: Two Chinese nationals were arrested in Greater Noida for their alleged involvement in cyber fraud. The accused, Feng Chenjin and Huang Kuan, had put out an app through which they lured Indian citizens into making easy money online and later cheated them, police said. Over 150 SIM cards, two laptops and ₹30,000 cash, among others were recovered from the accused.

132.title: It's special win for us: Berrington on Scotland's win vs WI in T20 WC
132.article_body: After Scotland's 42-run win against West Indies in Group B match in T20 World Cup 2022,  Scotland skipper Richard Berrington said, "It's a special win for us." He added, "A lot of hard work has been put in for this in...last one year. Extremely proud of the boys." Chasing 161, West Indies were bowled out for 118 in 18.3 overs.

133.title: Boy dies after teacher thrashes him for failing a test in Greater Noida
133.article_body: A school teacher in Greater Noida has been arrested for allegedly thrashing a 12-year-old student. Police said the boy was beaten because he had failed a test. The child died of internal bleeding in the brain, although there are no antemortem injuries that would have directly caused it, the boy's post-mortem report said.

134.title: Centre suspends IAS officer Narain accused of raping woman in Andaman & Nicobar
134.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has suspended 1990-batch IAS officer of AGMUT Cadre Jitendra Narain for the alleged rape of a woman in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, said an official. The government received a report on the alleged sexual assault, said MHA official Ashutosh Agnihotri. The report indicated "grave misconduct and misuse of official position" by Narain, he said.

135.title: SC rejects Kerala's plea against leasing Thiruvananthapuram airport to Adani
135.article_body: Supreme Court has dismissed the Kerala government's plea challenging the handover of the operations of the Thiruvananthapuram International Airport to Adani Enterprises Limited. The Airport Authority of India has allowed the Adani Group to operate, manage and develop the airport for 50 years. The airport was handed over to the group in October last year.

136.title: The fight against inflation will be dogged and prolonged: RBI
136.article_body: The RBI, in its October bulletin, said, "The fight against inflation will be dogged and prolonged, given the long and variable lags with which monetary policy operates, and fraught with uncertainties." Inflation has been above the Monetary Policy Committee's 2%-6% target band for three consecutive quarters. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) rose to 7.41% in September from 7% in August.

137.title: A vehicle is stolen every 12 mins in NCR: Report
137.article_body: According to a report by ACKO, vehicle theft accounts for nearly 20% of total crimes reported in Delhi-NCR, translating to about a vehicle theft every 12 minutes. According to the report, the areas most prone to vehicle theft are Rohini, Bhajanpura, Uttam Nagar, Sector 12 Noida, Gurugram and Sultanpuri. Popular cars like Wagon-R and Swift Dzire are stolen the most.

138.title: Good actors bring out the best in you: Ajay on working with Akshaye Khanna
138.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn, sharing his experience of working with Akshaye Khanna in 'Drishyam 2', said, "It is always great to work with a good actor because good actors bring out the best in you also." The duo previously worked together in 'Deewangee', a crime-drama film which was released in 2002. 'Drishyam 2' is set to release on November 18.

139.title: Batting was disappointing: WI skipper Pooran after loss to Scotland
139.article_body: Following his side's 42-run loss to Scotland in the T20 World Cup round one game, West Indies skipper Nicholas Pooran said that their batting was disappointing after the powerplay overs. "We got to do the hard work now...160 was a par score. The middle-order batting was disappointing. The ball was not spinning much. We got to reflect," Pooran said.

140.title: Tenders issued for construction of 4 flyovers between Hebbal, Basaveshwara Circle
140.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Sunday issued tenders for construction of flyovers over four intersections between Basaveshwara Circle and Hebbal. The tenders were issued for consultancy services to prepare a feasibility report and Detailed Project Report. The report will also study feasibility of building a single, long flyover, said BBMP chief Tushar Giri Nath.

141.title: 2-year-old girl raped and thrown near railway tracks in Ghaziabad
141.article_body: A two-year-old girl was raped by an unidentified man and later thrown near railway tracks in Ghaziabad. The girl was missing since Friday, said Gyanendra Singh, Additional SP (city-2), adding that the victim's mother is mentally disturbed and begs for a living. The matter was reported by a local on Saturday and the police have detained five people for questioning.

142.title: More than 600 people dead, 1.3 mn displaced in flood-hit Nigeria
142.article_body: The death toll from the recent flooding in Nigeria has crossed the 600-mark, the government informed on Sunday. The disaster has forced more than 1.3 million people to abandon their homes, according to Nigeria's ministry of humanitarian affairs. The flooding also completely destroyed over 82,000 houses and around 2,72,000 acres of farmland, the minister added.

143.title: Shalin Bhanot is fake, Gori Nagori is toxic: Bigg Boss 16's Sreejita
143.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Sreejita De, who was recently evicted from the show, called her co-contestants Shalin Bhanot and Gori Nagori "fake" and "toxic", respectively. "Shalin has a lot of unnecessary attitude problems and a superiority complex," Sreejita stated. Speaking about Gori, Sreejita said, "I don't share a healthy equation with her...I wouldn't want to stay around such people."

144.title: Anil shares old pics of brother Sanjay Kapoor on his b'day, pens note
144.article_body: Anil Kapoor wished actor-brother Sanjay Kapoor on his birthday via an Instagram post on Monday. Sharing some old pictures of his brother, Anil wrote, "I admire your spirit, humour, never die attitude, the way you look after and love our mother and your family." "I truly believe...60 is just the beginning of even more wonderful decades for you," Anil added.

145.title: Man found murdered with head, hand chopped off in Pune, 3 arrested
145.article_body: Pune Police have arrested three persons after a 28-year-old man was found murdered in the Velha taluka of the Pune district. Police had discovered the man's decomposing body on October 12. The head and the left hand of the body were found chopped off. Police have identified the deceased as Rahul Prakash Rawat, a resident of Indrayani Nagar in Bhosari.

146.title: Voting trend shows Kharge is favourite: Ex-Tamil Nadu Cong chief
146.article_body: On the day of voting for the Congress Presidential polls, former chief of the party's Tamil Nadu unit Su Thirunavukkarasar said that the "voting trend shows Mallikarjun Kharge is the favourite". "Elections are held transparently and there's nothing wrong with Shashi Tharoor's candidature. People can vote for whomever they want since elections are held within the party," Thirunavukkarasar said.

147.title: Scooter-borne woman run over by bus after tipping over pothole in B'luru
147.article_body: A 50-year-old scooter-borne woman was run over by a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation bus in Bengaluru's Rajajinagar on Monday after her two-wheeler skidded upon falling in a pothole. The woman, who was travelling with her daughter, was critically injured and was shifted to the hospital. "Only after a probe, we'll...know the cause," said BBMP Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath.

148.title: Actress Vaishali Takkar's neighbours booked for abetment in her suicide
148.article_body: A day after actress Vaishali Takkar allegedly died by suicide in Indore, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said police have filed a case of abetment of suicide against her neighbour Rahul Navlani and his wife Disha. "A five-page suicide note was found at the spot in which Vaishali named Rahul for harassing her," ACP Motiur Rahman said.

149.title: Mumbai woman struggles for 28 yrs to get property docs, NHRC files case
149.article_body: NHRC has reportedly registered a case after a Mumbai-based widow struggled for 28 years to get her original property documents from a registration office. Citizens Vigilance Forum President Kashyap M Vyas said that due to the absence of these documents, the family is unable to sell/gift the property. CVF had written to PM Narendra Modi and NHRC over the matter.

150.title: Delhi Police arrest 4 members of 'Thak Thak' gang
150.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested four members of 'Thak Thak' gang, who knock on car windows to distract people's attention to rob them. With these arrests, police have reportedly solved four theft cases and recovered four stolen laptops from their possession. The accused are aged between 24-54 years and one of them has worked as a 'junior artist' in Tamil films.

151.title: Russian drones hit sunflower oil tanks in Mykolaiv: Ukraine
151.article_body: Three Russian "kamikaze" drones hit sunflower oil storage tanks in the Ukrainian port city of Mykolaiv late on Sunday, causing the tanks to go up in flames, the city mayor said on Monday. The attack took place hours before suspected Iranian-made drones allegedly launched by Russian forces struck the capital Kyiv. Mykolaiv has been under constant shelling in recent months.

152.title: NTPC, Mitsubishi sign MoU to demonstrate hydrogen co-firing with natural gas
152.article_body: NTPC signed an MoU with Japan's Mitsubishi Heavy Industries and its subsidiary Mitsubishi Power India Private Limited to demonstrate the feasibility of hydrogen co-firing blended with natural gas in MHI 701D gas turbines. The turbines are installed at NTPC's Auraiya Gas Power Plant in Uttar Pradesh. The total installed capacity of the Auraiya Gas Power Plant is 663 MW.

153.title: JP Morgan announces multiple major role changes for India division
153.article_body: JP Morgan India announced a major internal rejig of roles with former Reliance Industries mergers and acquisitions head Navin Wadhwani being appointed as the new investment banking chief. Kaustubh Kulkarni replaced Madhav Kalyan as the Senior Country Officer (SCO) for India. Kalyan has been appointed as head of Asia Pacific Payments, succeeding Sridhar Kanthadai.

154.title: Village head hires man to poison 18 stray dogs to death in Andhra; 3 arrested
154.article_body: The head of Chebrole village in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru district and two others were arrested for allegedly poisoning 18 stray dogs and killing them. The sarpanch allegedly gave an informal contract to a man to poison the dogs and he was promised ₹300 for every dog that he killed. All three accused were released on bail later.

155.title: BFI appoints ex-Irish boxer Dunne as India's High Performance Director
155.article_body: Ex-Irish boxer Bernard Dunne has been appointed as High Performance Director for Indian boxing, announced Boxing Federation of India (BFI). The 42-year-old was in charge of the Irish boxing team from 2017 to 2022 and helped the boxers win European, world and Olympic gold medals. "India has huge boxing talent and its boxers have been performing exceedingly well," said Dunne.

156.title: Remove Shah Rukh & make Ganguly ambassador of WB: BJP to Mamata over BCCI remark
156.article_body: The Leader of Opposition in the Bengal Assembly and BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee over her appeal to PM Narendra Modi to let BCCI President Sourav Ganguly contest the ICC elections. "Remove Shah Rukh Khan and make Sourav Ganguly the brand ambassador of West Bengal," Adhikari said, adding PM Modi stays out of such things.

157.title: Hetero buys J&J's manufacturing unit in Telangana for ₹130 crore: Report
157.article_body: Pharmaceuticals firm Hetero has acquired Johnson & Johnson's manufacturing plant at Penjerla in Telangana for a reported sum of ₹130 crore. The company said it will invest additional ₹600 crore on its upgradation. Hetero, in its statement, added that the facility will be Hetero's flagship sterile pharmaceutical and biologics manufacturing unit and will generate 2,000 new jobs.

158.title: Akhilesh Yadav immerses ashes of father Mulayam Singh in Haridwar; SP shares pics
158.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday immersed the ashes of his father, SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, in the Ganga river in Uttarakhand's Haridwar. He was accompanied by his wife Dimple Yadav and other relatives. Mulayam Singh passed away at Medanta Hospital in Gurugram after a prolonged illness last week.

159.title: Hardik's reaction after missing Mitchell Starc's delivery caught on stump mic, video viral
159.article_body: Hardik Pandya's reaction after missing a Mitchell Starc delivery during India-Australia T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match was caught on stump mic. A video of the same has gone viral on social media. In the video, Hardik can be heard saying, "Mujhe pata hi nahi chala. Kab aaya, kab beat hua. Pata hi nahi chala."

160.title: Shocked at Ganguly's removal as BCCI chief, urge PM to ensure he contests ICC polls: Mamata
160.article_body: Reacting to Sourav Ganguly not getting another term as BCCI President, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "He's been deprived. What is his fault? I am very sad. I am really shocked." She added, "Why was he excluded in such an unfair way?" She further urged PM Narendra Modi to ensure Ganguly is allowed to contests ICC elections.

161.title: Ayushmann & Rakul-starrer 'Doctor G' collects ₹15 cr on opening weekend
161.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana, Rakul Preet Singh and Shefali Shah-starrer 'Doctor G' has earned over ₹15 crore at the domestic box office within three days of its release. The film, directed by Anubhuti Kashyap, earned ₹3.87 crore, ₹5.22 crore and ₹5.94 crore on Friday, Saturday and Sunday respectively, as per film trade analyst Taran Adarsh.

162.title: 18-month-old girl falls into bucket full of water in Chennai, dies
162.article_body: An 18-month-old girl allegedly died after she fell into a bucket full of water at her house in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The girl's mother was outside the house, while her father had gone to work when the incident took place on Saturday. Meanwhile, police have registered a case into the matter and have sent the deceased girl's body for postmortem.

163.title: 5-star hotel manager in Rajasthan assaults wife for not playing 'wife swap' game, booked
163.article_body: A five-star hotel manager in Bikaner was booked for allegedly assaulting his wife for months and having unnatural sex with her for not being part of a 'wife swap' game. She said, "Drinking alcohol, taking drugs, having physical relations with different girls, and even having sex with boys was normal for him." She added that her in-laws demanded ₹50 lakh.

164.title: You've to lie a lot: Saif Ali Khan on why he's not on social media
164.article_body: Saif Ali Khan was asked about his absence from social media on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. To this, Saif replied he was unable to find a handle in his name. Kapil said there's too much tension on such platforms. "I feel the same. You've to lie a lot...I do lie. But you can get stuck on social media," Saif replied.

165.title: 85-86% of Russian drones involved in latest attacks shot down: Kyiv
165.article_body: Ukrainian forces have shot down 37 Russian drones, which account for nearly 85-86% of the number involved in attacks, since Sunday evening, Ukraine's air force spokesperson Yuriy Ihnat said on Monday. "That's quite a good result for the work of our air defences," he stated. All the drones had flown into Ukraine from the south, the official added.

166.title: How was your experience in Delhi: MCD asks people to share perception
166.article_body: Under the 'My City My Pride' campaign, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is asking citizens to share their experiences of the national capital. MCD has shared a QR code for the citizens to take part in the Ease of Living (EOL) 2022 citizen perception survey about the city. MCD has also shared a video of a poem about Delhi.

167.title: Two Mumbai policemen arrested for extorting ₹10,000 from merchant
167.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector and a constable have been arrested for allegedly extorting ₹10,000 from a diamond merchant by threatening to file an FIR against him. The officers, posted at Mumbai's Sir JJ Marg Police Station, reportedly stopped the victim's car and forced him into a police van where they threatened him. The merchant later narrated the incident on Twitter.

168.title: China's state banks swapping yuan for USD to stabilise yuan: Report
168.article_body: China's state banks sold high volume of dollars, swapped yuan for dollars in forwards market and sold those dollars in the spot market on Monday, Reuters reported. The selling is likely aimed at stabilising yuan, which is down 11.6% against USD this year. State banks' trades appeared to be managed to ensure China's foreign reserves aren't used for this operation.

169.title: KSRTC to run 1,500 special buses during Diwali in Karnataka
169.article_body: The Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) has decided to run 1,500 special buses from October 21 to October 30 to cater to the rush of commuters during Diwali. According to the KSRTC, these buses will operate exclusively from Bengaluru's Kempegowda bus station. The KSRTC is expecting increased passenger loads, especially to and from Bengaluru.

170.title: No reports of sexual harassment: Miranda House Principal on fest incident
170.article_body: No incidents of sexual harassment have been reported from DU's Miranda House, the college's Principal said on Monday, after unknown men attempted to enter the college during a Diwali fest last week. Earlier, students took to social media and shared videos of a few men scaling the college's boundary wall, roaming around on the campus and raising slogans.

171.title: It'll bring big positive change: PM on launch of Hindi MBBS books
171.article_body: After the Hindi version of MBBS books was launched in Madhya Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi said, "This beginning in the field of medical education is going to bring a big positive change in the country." "With this, while lakhs of students will be able to study in their own language, many doors of opportunities will...open for them," PM Modi added.

172.title: We're demonstrating real democracy: Venugopal on Cong chief poll
172.article_body: Speaking about the Congress Presidential poll, party leader KC Venugopal on Monday said it's a moment of pride for the entire Congress that the party is in a democratic process to elect the Congress President. "We're demonstrating real democracy. Nobody will be rubber stamp President," he added. "It's only Congress that can elect party President," Venugopal stated.

173.title: Uttarakhand CM meets Indian Ambassadors to 7 countries in Dehradun
173.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami met seven Indian Ambassadors at his Dehradun residence and discussed promotion of the "One District Two Products" scheme. "More efforts are needed to make people aware of the local products of Uttarakhand in different countries...Uttarakhand has many possibilities in the fields of tourism, industry and horticulture," said Dhami.

174.title: Armed robbers enter Delhi-Kolkata Duronto Express, loot passengers at gunpoint
174.article_body: Some miscreants entered the Delhi-Kolkata Duronto Express on Sunday and looted some passengers of their valuables at gunpoint in Bihar, reports said. Reports added that the miscreants barged into the train and snatched chains from passengers. The passengers then lodged a complaint with the Government Railway Police. An FIR has been registered.

175.title: Gujarat govt cuts VAT on CNG & PNG by 10%; to give 2 free LPG cylinders
175.article_body: Gujarat government on Monday announced that it has cut value-added tax (VAT) on CNG and PNG by 10%. As a result of the VAT-cut, consumers using CNG will benefit by ₹6-7/kg while those using PNG will benefit by ₹5-6/kg. The government has also announced that two free LPG cylinders will be given to beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY).

176.title: LJP (Ram Vilas) to contest Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh polls: Paswan
176.article_body: LJP (Ram Vilas) President Chirag Paswan has confirmed that the party will be contesting the upcoming Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls. However, the party is yet to take a decision on the number of seats it will contest in the elections. Voting for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls will be held in a single phase on November 12.

177.title: Comparing Sisodia, Jain with Bhagat Singh unfortunate: Punjab Cong chief
