177.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring criticised AAP national convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for comparing party leaders Manish Sisodia and Satyendar Jain with freedom fighter Bhagat Singh, terming it "unfortunate". "It is not right to compare anyone with Bhagat Singh…No individual can ever match the sacrifice and commitment of Shaheed-e-Azam Bhagat Singh Ji," Warring added.

178.title: Shooting in US' Pittsburgh leaves 3 people dead, 1 injured
178.article_body: Three people, including two women, were killed and one man was injured following a shooting incident in US' Pittsburgh, authorities said. The injured man, who arrived at a hospital, had a gunshot wound to the leg and is in stable condition, a Pittsburgh Public Safety spokesperson said. The incident occurred near a busy intersection around 10 pm, officials said.

179.title: Sikandar Raza smashes highest-ever score by a Zimbabwe batter in T20 World Cup history
179.article_body: Zimbabwe middle-order batter Sikandar Raza on Monday created history by smashing the highest-ever score by a Zimbabwe batter in the history of T20 World Cup. The 36-year-old scored 82(48) against Ireland to set the record. The previous record was held by Brendan Taylor, who had smashed 60*(45) against Australia in T20 World Cup 2007.

180.title: Kejriwal should keep his anxiety in check, worst yet to come: Malviya
180.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Monday said that Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal is behaving like a "schizophrenic" and tweeting incessantly about Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. "He should keep his anxiety in check because the worst is perhaps still to come," Malviya tweeted. Sisodia on Monday reached the CBI headquarters for questioning in Delhi excise policy case.

181.title: Sajid Khan asked my breast size, frequency of sex: Bhojpuri actress Rani Chatterjee
181.article_body: Bhojpuri actress Rani Chatterjee has accused Sajid Khan of sexual harassment. Rani said Sajid invited her to his house and told her she will be wearing a short lehenga in an item song and asked her to show her legs, which she did. According to her, Sajid then asked her about her breast size and about the frequency of intercourse.

182.title: AAP raises 'Jab Modi darta hai police ko aage karta hai' slogan against summon to Sisodia
182.article_body: After CBI summoned AAP leader and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in the Delhi excise policy scam, the party workers protested against the BJP-led central government. Videos from the protest site showed AAP workers attacking PM Narendra Modi and sloganeering, "Jab jab Modi darta hai, police ko aage karta hai." Earlier, AAP had said that CBI would arrest Sisodia today.

183.title: Dharmendra is definitely the most handsome man I've met: Hema Malini
183.article_body: Actress-politician Hema Malini said her husband Dharmendra is "definitely the most handsome man" she's ever met. "That's why I married him. I guess we do make a beautiful couple," said Hema, who recently turned 74. Talking about her birthday wish, Hema said, "Dharamji and I should remain healthy" and added that their fans' love "is like oxygen" for their souls.

184.title: One of my most difficult characters: Tabu on 'Drishyam 2'
184.article_body: Actress Tabu said her 'Drishyam 2' character is one of her "most difficult" roles. "I must give credit for writing this character. It's very unusual for writers to write such a complex character," she added. Tabu reprises her role as Meera Deshmukh in the Abhishek Pathak directorial, which is the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film with the same title.

185.title: Nitish is 'master' in Bihar govt, rest are rubber stamps: RJD leader
185.article_body: Former Bihar Agriculture Minister, Sudhakar Singh, said that Nitish Kumar is the "master" in the state government and the rest are "mere rubber stamps". He said that the CM avoided the issues that he raised because votes are cast based on caste lines and not pressing issues. The government's decision to provide 10 lakh jobs is a "jumla".

186.title: It took 7 months to rewrite 'Drishyam 2', made a lot of changes: Director
186.article_body: Director Abhishek Pathak revealed that there are a lot of changes in Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Drishyam 2', which is the remake of a Malayalam film of the same name. "We took 7 months to rewrite the film," he added. Meanwhile, Ajay said the film has been treated in a different manner, adding that audiences will feel it's a "fresh film".

187.title: It's an adventure story: Vijayendra on Mahesh Babu & Rajamouli's film
187.article_body: SS Rajamouli's father and writer KV Vijayendra Prasad has said that the 'Baahubali' director and Mahesh Babu's film is an adventure story. When asked if the film will be inspired by real-life events, Vijayendra replied, "Yes, you can write it." He further revealed that the film will roll out next year. Rajamouli had recently directed 'RRR', which featured Jr NTR.

188.title: Kanye West to buy right-wing social media app Parler
188.article_body: Kanye West is buying the right-wing social media app Parler, which has been banned by Apple and Google multiple times and was used to coordinate the January 6 Capitol riot. The rapper, known as Ye, said, "In a world where conservative opinions are considered to be controversial we have to make sure we have the right to freely express ourselves."

189.title: Anil performs with Norwegian dance group Quick Style, fans react
189.article_body: Anil Kapoor recently performed with 'Quick Style', a Norwegian dance group whose performance on the song 'Kala Chashma' went viral. The actor and the dance group performed on the song 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha'. Reacting to the video on Instagram, a fan wrote, "The collaboration we all needed," while another commented, "Best thing on the internet today."

190.title: Good outing: Suryakumar on India's 6-run win vs Aus in T20 WC warm-up match
190.article_body: Following India's six-run win against Australia in T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match in Brisbane, India batter Suryakumar Yadav took to Twitter and wrote, "Good outing." Suryakumar scored 50 runs off 33 balls. Put to bat first, India scored 186/7 in 20 overs. Opener KL Rahul top-scored for India with a 33-ball 57.

191.title: Underpass work on Greater Noida's Kisan Chowk to begin soon: Official
191.article_body: The Greater Noida authority will soon start construction work on an underpass proposed at the Kisan Chowk. The decision has been taken to address the traffic congestion in the area. "We hope that the DPR [of the underpass] is prepared in the next two-three months, paving way for construction work to begin at the site," an official said.

192.title: We learnt we need to be clinical towards the end: Finch after defeat vs India
192.article_body: With Australia losing six wickets in the last two overs while chasing India's 187-run target in their warm-up match, Australia captain Aaron Finch said, "We learnt that we need to be clinical towards the back-end." Finch added, "We did drag them back after that blistering start from KL Rahul." Rahul scored 57 off 33 balls in the match.

193.title: 14-month-old girl falls into bucket of water, dies in Haryana
193.article_body: A 14-month-old girl died after she allegedly fell into a bucket filled with water in a village in Haryana's Rohtak. The girl's father had gone for work and her mother was also not present at home when the incident took place, according to the police. An ASI said that the girl had gone into the bathroom where bucket was kept.

194.title: Man kills wife & kids in Hyd, neighbours alert police after sensing foul smell
194.article_body: A man killed his wife and two kids, aged seven and 11, with a scissor and later killed himself in Hyderabad. The police found the bodies on Monday, three days after the incident took place, following complaints by the neighbours about a foul smell coming from the house. Police are trying to ascertain if the accused had any mental illness.

195.title: Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital submits ₹1,200 cr plan to build facilities
195.article_body: Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital has submitted a fresh proposal to the Centre worth ₹1,200 crore to build maternity and childcare wing and hostels on its campus, officials said. The proposal was submitted again following a delay in construction due to coronavirus pandemic, Medical Superintendent Dr BL Sherwal said. Hostel project will start next year after getting Centre's approval, Sherwal added.

196.title: 22-yr-old Galgotias University student who was found dead in drain had drowned: Police
196.article_body: The 22-year-old Galgotias University student who was found dead in a drain a few days ago had drowned, Noida Police said citing his post-mortem report. Yashasvi Raj, a second-year BSc Agriculture student, had been missing since October 12. His family members had alleged that five students killed him after a fight. There were no apparent injuries on the body.

197.title: Youth tied to scooter, dragged on streets for not paying borrowed money in Odisha
197.article_body: A youth was tied to a scooter and dragged on the busy streets in Odisha's Cuttack for non-payment of borrowed money, police said. A video of the incident went viral on social media. Police have detained two people in connection with the case. Police said that the victim has also been identified.

198.title: Engine oil entering air-conditioning system caused smoke in SpiceJet Hyd flight: DGCA
198.article_body: After the Goa-Hyderabad SpiceJet flight made an emergency landing due to smoke in its cabin, DGCA said it was a result of the engine oil entering the aircraft's air-conditioning system. The DGCA also ordered SpiceJet to send all oil samples to Pratt & Whitney Canada every 15 days to ensure no metal or carbon seal components are present in them.

199.title: Want Rahul to stop Bharat Jodo Yatra, focus on poll-bound states: Cong MP
199.article_body: Congress MP Francisco Sardinha on Monday said he wants party leader Rahul Gandhi to stop the Bharat Jodo Yatra and focus on poll-bound Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat to "awaken the public" so that "they vote for the only party that can defeat BJP". "The only party that can be an Opposition to BJP is Congress," Sardinha added.

200.title: Wanted drug trafficker arrested with mephedrone worth ₹1 lakh in Pune
200.article_body: The Anti Narcotics Cell of the Pune City Police have arrested a 35-year-old wanted drug peddler identified as Asif Patel. Police have seized around six grams of mephedrone, estimated to be worth ₹1 lakh, and 0.6 grams of liquid ecstasy (MDMA) from his possession. Reportedly, Patel was wanted by the police for a past offence of mephedrone trafficking.

201.title: Man slips while travelling on local train's footboard in Mumbai; video surfaces
201.article_body: A video showing a man falling off from a crowded local train in Mumbai has gone viral. It can be seen in the video that the man lost balance from footboard of the local train he was travelling in and fell on the railway station's platform. However, he manages to save himself from potential mishap and stands up after falling.

202.title: Man who vandalised cars at DCW chief's house sings '4 Botal Vodka' at police station
202.article_body: The man who broke into Delhi Commission for Women's (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal's house and vandalised cars was seen singing 'Chaar Botal Vodka' at a police station after being held. A video has surfaced online showing him dressed inappropriately and dancing while singing the song. Earlier, Maliwal shared pictures of the damaged cars at her residence.

203.title: Bezos family to donate $710.5 mn to cancer centre in US' Seattle
203.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' family has announced that they would donate $710.5 million over the next decade to Fred Hutchinson Cancer Centre in US' Seattle. The donation will fund recruitment of 36 new researchers, construction of a new 3.9 lakh-square-foot research building and expansion of immunotherapy research. It'll also fund expansion of institution-wide clinical research capabilities.

204.title: Vaishali Takkar was going to marry US-based software engineer in December, reveal friends
204.article_body: Late actress Vaishali Takkar's friends, actor Vikas Sethi and his wife Jhanvi Rana, have revealed that she was set to get married to a software engineer based out of California in December. "She told me that she was coming to Mumbai post-Diwali for her wedding shopping," said Jhanvi. The 29-year-old actress died by suicide on Sunday.

205.title: World no. 1 Iga Swiatek wins 8th title of 2022 at San Diego Open
205.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek won her eighth title of the year, defeating qualifier Donna Vekic 6-3, 3-6, 6-0 in San Diego Open final. It was the 21-year-old's 64th match win of the year, the most since Serena Williams' 78 in 2013. Overall, it was Swiatek's 11th WTA singles title. Swiatek has lost only one final in 2022.

206.title: I never asked for my departure in January: Mbappe on PSG exit rumours
206.article_body: Reacting to the recent reports claiming that he wants to leave PSG during the next transfer window, striker Kylian Mbappe said he's very happy at the club and he's not involved in the rumours "directly or indirectly". He added, "I never asked for my departure in January...I was as shocked by this news as everyone else...it's completely false."

207.title: Firecrackers worth ₹6 cr seized during raids in Bihar ahead of Diwali
207.article_body: Firecrackers worth ₹6 crore were seized during raids at 13 locations across Bihar ahead of Diwali. All of them procured huge consignments without proper documents and tax payments under the goods and services tax (GST). The raids were carried out on Saturday and Sunday. The raids were also conducted in Patna.

208.title: Virat Kohli takes one-handed flying catch against Australia, video goes viral
208.article_body: A video has gone viral showing ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli taking a one-handed flying catch to dismiss Australia pacer Pat Cummins off Mohammad Shami during their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match on Monday. Kohli took the catch while fielding at long on. India defeated Australia by six runs after taking four wickets on the last four deliveries.

209.title: Crux of 'Salaar' is very much between Prabhas & my characters: Prithviraj
209.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Prithviraj Sukumaran said Salaar's "crux" revolves around his and Prabhas' characters. Prithviraj, who plays Vardharaja Mannaar in the film, said he's glad that he said yes to 'Salaar' as it "might just be one of those epic cinematic experiences". "I deem it a privilege that somebody like Prashanth Neel...thought it was worth waiting for me," he added.

210.title: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia seeks mother's blessings before CBI questioning
210.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia sought his mother's blessings before appearing for CBI questioning in his alleged involvement in the Delhi excise policy scam. AAP shared images of Sisodia meeting his mother on the party's official Twitter handle saying, "Whoever has his mother's blessings, has the hand of God on his head."

211.title: Japan PM orders probe into Unification Church after Abe's killing
211.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida on Monday ordered an investigation into the Unification Church after ties between it and lawmakers of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) surfaced following Shinzo Abe's assassination. Abe's suspected killer blamed the ex-PM for endorsing the group, accusing it of leading his mother to bankruptcy. Critics call the church a cult that relies on dubious fund-raising.

212.title: Sensational in all 3 departments, India look ready for T20 WC: Uthappa
212.article_body: After India's win in the T20 World Cup warm-up match against Australia, ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa said 'Men in Blue' looking ready for the T20 World Cup. "Lethal bowling by Shami...Brilliant piece of fielding by Virat and terrific batting from Rahul and Suryakumar! Sensational in all three departments," tweeted Uthappa. India defeated Australia by six runs in the warm-up match.

213.title: We know how lethal he is: Rohit on Shami's 3/4 vs Aus in T20 WC warm-up match
213.article_body: Discussing pacer Mohammad Shami's spell of 3/4 in India's T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match against Australia, Rohit Sharma said, "We know how lethal he can be." "We wanted to give him a challenge and let him bowl the final over," added Rohit. Shami picked three wickets in the 20th over, helping India beat Australia by six runs.

214.title: BBMP commissioner conducts on-site inspections to check pothole repair works
214.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) Chief Commissioner conducted a joint inspection of various civic projects going on in Bengaluru's East zone, including filling of potholes. He reviewed the works and asked the officials to clear roads at the earliest. Earlier this month, Karnataka HC warned BBMP of punitive orders against civic officials for not completing pothole repair works.

215.title: Mumbai records highest rainfall in Oct in 10 yrs, yellow alert issued for Oct 17-18
215.article_body: Mumbai's Santacruz Observatory has recorded 216 mm of rainfall so far in October, the highest in a decade. Mumbai had received 197.7 mm of rainfall in October 2012, while the average rainfall the city receives during October is around 91 mm. The India Meteorological Department has also issued a 'yellow' alert for Mumbai for October 17-18.

216.title: Rahul Gandhi casts vote at Bharat Jodo Yatra campsite in Karnataka
216.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday cast his vote to elect the next party President at Bharat Jodo Yatra campsite in Karnataka's Ballari. Meanwhile, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, along with party leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, cast her vote for the next party chief in Delhi. The results will be declared on October 19.

217.title: An extremely vulnerable day: Prateik on Smita Patil's birth anniversary
217.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said his late mother and veteran actress Smita Patil's birth anniversary is "an extremely vulnerable" day for him. Remembering Patil on her 67th birth anniversary, Babbar said the actress "was always loved" by people and he wants to "carry forward that emotion". "I feel extremely blessed and humbled with all the wishes that pour in," he added.

218.title: Only got 'we want to slap you' feedback: Navika on 'English Vinglish'
218.article_body: Navika Kotia, who played Sridevi's daughter in 'English Vinglish', revealed that she didn't get any offer from Bollywood after the film, adding, "I only got...we-want-to-slap-you feedback." "Till date, when people realise I played Sridevi's daughter, they tell me 'I felt like slapping you'," she added. "I take it as a compliment because...I was supposed to trigger people in...film," said Navika.

219.title: Accident averted as truck rolls backwards on Mumbai-Pune Expressway
219.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a truck loaded with iron roads moving backwards reportedly after its brake failed on Mumbai-Pune Expressway near Lonavala. However, the driver of the heavy-sized vehicle managed to take control of it amidst brake failure, thus averting a major accident. The driver of the vehicle has been identified as Shitafi.

220.title: BTS members to serve in the military, band to reunite in 2025
220.article_body: All seven members of the K-pop boy band BTS will go off on mandatory military service, their agency said on Monday. They are looking forward to reconvening as a group again around 2025. Notably, all able-bodied males aged 18 to 28 in South Korea are required to serve in the military for about two years to guard against North Korea.

221.title: Targeted killings will never stop until justice is served: Farooq Abdullah
221.article_body: NC chief Farooq Abdullah claimed that incidents of targeted killings by terrorists in J&K are not going to stop until justice is served. "Earlier, they said such killings were happening due to Article 370, but it's abrogated now, so why such killings haven't stopped? Who's responsible?" Abdullah said. Earlier on Saturday, a Kashmiri Pandit was killed by militants in Shopian.

222.title: 44-yr-old passes obscene remarks at 16-yr-old Thane schoolgirl
222.article_body: A 44-year-old man was arrested for passing obscene remarks at a 16-year-old schoolgirl in Thane, a police official said on Sunday. The victim, a class 10 student, was returning after writing an exam on Saturday morning when the incident took place, the official added. The accused worked at a showroom and was pinned down by a civic security guard.

223.title: Request PM to allow Sourav Ganguly to contest ICC election: Mamata
223.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee appealed to PM Narendra Modi that Sourav Ganguly must be allowed to contest ICC election. "He's a popular figure which is why he is being deprived," Mamata said. "Request the Government of India not to take a decision politically, but for cricket, sports," she added. Nominations for ICC election will be filed on October 20.

224.title: We demand restoration of statehood for J&K: Ghulam Nabi Azad
224.article_body: Democratic Azad Party chief Ghulam Nabi Azad demanded the restoration of statehood for Jammu and Kashmir ahead of the Assembly elections, which will be held next year. "We have three main agendas. First to restore statehood, second to reserve rights to purchase lands for J&K people only and third to reserve jobs for local youth," said Azad.

225.title: 18-yr-old tuition teacher gang-raped in UP's Lucknow
225.article_body: An 18-year-old tuition teacher was allegedly gang-raped after she had boarded an auto-rickshaw to reach her home in Lucknow, UP. The victim was allegedly raped by the auto-rickshaw driver and one other passenger, police said. The accused have been identified and efforts are on to arrest them, police added. The victim had taken the auto-rickshaw from Kathauta crossing.

226.title: Nokia wins multi-year deal to supply 5G hardware to Reliance Jio
226.article_body: Nokia announced that it has signed a multi-year contract with Reliance Jio to supply 5G Radio Access Network (RAN) hardware across the nation. According to a press filing, Nokia will supply equipment from its AirScale portfolio, including base stations, high-capacity 5G Massive MIMO antennas, and Remote Radio Heads (RRH) to support different spectrum bands, and self-organizing network software.

227.title: Aditya Birla Capital receives nod to bid for Reliance Nippon Life Insurance
227.article_body: The Committee of Creditors (CoC) of Reliance Capital has approved a proposal by Aditya Birla Capital to bid for Reliance Nippon Life Insurance Company. The approval would accelerate Reliance Capital's ongoing bankruptcy process. A valuer appointed by the administrator for Reliance Capital's insolvency proceedings had estimated the embedded value of the life insurance company at ₹5,800 crore.

228.title: Fire breaks out at sports store in Pune; no one injured
228.article_body: A fire broke out at a sports store in the Deccan Gymkhana area in Pune on Monday. Five vehicles reached the spot and brought the blaze under control in around an hour. No one was injured in the incident. A police team has been deployed in the area to control the traffic situation and the crowd.

229.title: Pro-democracy protester pulled into Chinese consulate, beaten in UK
229.article_body: A pro-democracy protester was dragged into the Chinese consulate and allegedly assaulted in UK's Manchester before being rescued by police officers who entered the compound. The incident occurred when a group of people protested outside the consulate on Sunday against the 20th National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party. A video and pictures of the incident have surfaced online.

230.title: Hema Malini & I were never friends, 'Seeta...' was offered to me: Mumtaz
230.article_body: Actress Mumtaz said she was never friends with Hema Malini. "We were pitted against one another, so there was always a tension between us," she added. Mumtaz stated there were films she could not do, which Hema did and there were films that Hema could not do, which she did. She said 'Seeta Aur Geeta' was first offered to her.

231.title: Haven't seen captain who knows best time to attack after Dhoni: Misbah
231.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Misbah Ul Haq said he hasn't seen a captain who knows the best time to attack the opposition after MS Dhoni. "Captains these days don't do it much...You have to take a chance," added Misbah. "Mahela Jayawardena and Stephen Fleming...knew the batter's psyche and how to make their strength a weakness," he stated.

232.title: Sisodia raising slogans as if AAP won ‘World Cup in corruption’: BJP
232.article_body: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Monday said that AAP's Manish Sisodia was raising slogans in the car while going to the CBI office as if the party "had won the world cup on corruption". He added, "AAP is the biggest gimmick party. It was formed to fight corruption and its leaders turned out to be diehard corrupt."

233.title: Sealed iPhone from 2007 sells for $39,000 at auction, over 60 times its original price
233.article_body: An unopened first-generation iPhone from 2007 was auctioned for $39,339.60 by US-based LCG Auctions. When it was first released, the phone was priced at $499 to $599 and has now fetched over 60 times that price at the auction. The unused 8GB iPhone came with a 3.5-inch screen, a 2-megapixel camera, and a web browser.

234.title: Bombay HC grants bail to rape accused, asks him to marry untraceable victim within a year
234.article_body: The Bombay High Court granted bail to a 26-year-old man arrested in a rape case, setting a condition he'd have to marry the victim, who's currently untraceable, if she's found within a year. The court said the accused and the woman were in consensual relationship, but rape case was registered when he started avoiding her after learning she was pregnant.

235.title: Bar owner attacked in Pune for not serving liquor on credit
235.article_body: Owner of a bar in Pune's Narhe was allegedly attacked with a sharp object by five to seven people for denying them liquor on credit. The accused also damaged a computer and some kitchen equipment and when hotel staffers tried to intervene, the group threatened them and asked the other customers to leave the bar, according to the police complaint.

236.title: BJP won't contest Andheri East Assembly by-election: Maha BJP President
236.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrashekhar Bawankule has announced that the party will not contest Mumbai's Andheri East Assembly bypolls. Bawankule said that the party's candidate Murji Patel will withdraw the nomination. He made the announcement in Nagpur, reports said. "The BJP had previously also not contested some of the bypolls," he added.

237.title: Ola CEO asked a staffer to run 3 laps around the factory for a mistake: Report
237.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal asked a custodial manager to run three laps around the Ola Futurefactory in Tamil Nadu as a punishment, Bloomberg reported citing people who were present there at the time. Aggarwal had summoned the custodial manager after spotting a shuttered entryway that should have been left open. Ola claims Futurefactory is the world's largest two-wheeler factory.

238.title: Urvashi Rautela chops her hair in support of Iran's anti-hijab protests, shares pics
238.article_body: Urvashi Rautela has shared photos of herself getting her hair chopped in support of Iran's women protesters and Uttarakhand's Ankita Bhandari. The protests in Iran were prompted by the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini following her arrest for allegedly violating dress code. Meanwhile, Ankita Bhandari, a 19-year-old resort receptionist, was allegedly killed by an ex-BJP leader's son and two others.

239.title: Just Shami things: Jaffer on Aus losing 4 wickets off 4 balls vs India
239.article_body: Reacting to India pacer Mohammad Shami picking three wickets in the 20th over of India's T20 World Cup warm-up match against Australia on Monday, ex-cricketer Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Just Shami things." He added, "[Shami] joins the team late. Directly bowls the 20th over. Finishes with figures of 1-0-4-3. [India] win the game by six runs. Smiles."

240.title: Sanjay Singh, AAP leaders detained outside CBI HQ amid Manish Sisodia's questioning
240.article_body: Delhi Police detained all Aam Aadmi Party leaders and workers who were holding sit-in protest outside the CBI office during Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's questioning on Monday. Reports said AAP leaders, workers and MLAs including Sanjay Singh, Rakhi Birla and Jarnail Singh have been detained. "Modi's police is dragging and harassing women and senior readers," Sanjay Singh said.

241.title: The underdogs are putting on a show: Uthappa after Scotland beat WI
241.article_body: Reacting to Scotland defeating two-time champions West Indies by 42 runs in T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India cricketer Robin Uthappa tweeted, "The underdogs are putting on a show." "These aren't just wins, these are statements," read a tweet from Wasim Jaffer. Namibia had earlier defeated eighth-ranked Sri Lanka by 55 runs in the first match of T20 World Cup 2022.

242.title: BYJU'S raises $250 million days after laying off 2,500 employees
242.article_body: BYJU'S, the world's most-valuable edtech startup, has raised $250 million in a new funding round. Existing investors participated in the round, including Qatar Investment Authority, the startup announced on Monday. The fundraise comes days after BYJU'S announced plans to lay off about 2,500 employees across departments. The layoffs are aimed at cutting costs amid the company's mounting losses.

243.title: SRK attends AbRam's Taekwondo match with Aryan & Suhana, pics surface
243.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan on Sunday, along with Aryan Khan and Suhana Khan, attended AbRam's Taekwondo match. The event, which was also attended by Gauri Khan, saw Shah Rukh presenting medals to the winners in some of the photos, which have gone viral on social media. The pictures feature SRK kissing AbRam and Kareena Kapoor Khan's son Taimur Ali Khan.

244.title: PM Modi inaugurates 'PM Kisan Samman Sammelan', releases ₹16,000 crore
244.article_body: PM Modi inaugurated the two-day "PM Kisan Samman Sammelan" event in New Delhi today. It aims to bring together more than 13,500 farmers from across the country and around 1,500 agri startups. He also released PM-Kisan funds worth ₹16,000 crore through Direct Benefit Transfer. More than 1 crore farmers from various institutions are expected to attend the event virtually.

245.title: Parents allegedly kill 2 kids then die by suicide in Hyd: Police
245.article_body: Four members of a family, including two children, were found dead at their house in Hyderabad's Chandanagar on Monday. Police said that the parents allegedly killed the children and then died by suicide. Locals had found the bodies after they broke into the house following complaints of a foul smell. Police suspect that the incident occurred due to family disputes.

246.title: Considering bringing Pant back would be going in wrong direction: Aakash
246.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra said India will be heading in the "wrong direction" by thinking of including Rishabh Pant in their lineup for T20 World Cup 2022 as a last-minute change. "Pant's been tested at the top-order...[and] middle-order but you don't know whether you want to play him," added Aakash. "India should...stick with [the] six batters...they've tried out recently," he stated.

247.title: It’s a privilege, it's my 1st time captaining my country at WC: Rohit
247.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has said it's a privilege to captain the side in the T20 World Cup in Australia. "It's the first time in 15 years that I am captaining my country at a World Cup. We want to enjoy and have fun," he added. Rohit-led India defeated Australia by six runs in their warm-up match on Monday.

248.title: Even she's not safe: Kejriwal after DCW chief's house attacked in Delhi
248.article_body: After Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chairperson Swati Maliwal alleged that her house was attacked, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that even she is not safe in the national capital. "The law and order situation in Delhi has become very bad...I hope that LG Sahib will also give some time to fix the law and order situation," he added.

249.title: Delhi's Asola Bhati Mines to have 4 artificial waterfalls by Oct-end: Report
249.article_body: As many as four artificial waterfalls and 10 floating fountains will come up in the Neeli Jheel at Delhi's Asola Bhati Mines by the end of October, reports said. The trial of the waterfalls and fountains is currently going on. Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena visited the site on Sunday and oversaw the trials.

250.title: Scotland record their biggest win in T20 WC history, defeat 2-time champions West Indies
250.article_body: Scotland defeated two-time champions West Indies by 42 runs in their first match of T20 World Cup 2022. It is Scotland's biggest win (by runs) in T20 World Cup history. Batting first, Scotland put up a total of 160/5, with opener George Munsey top-scoring with 66*(53). West Indies were bowled out for 118 in 18.3 overs.

251.title: Tesla shares fall 50% from record high, market cap drops to $642 bn
251.article_body: The shares of Tesla closed down 7.6% to $204.99 on Friday, marking a 50% drop from its all-time high. The stock had closed at a record high of $409.97 on November 4, 2021. The drop took Tesla's market capitalisation to $642 billion. It has reportedly lost about a third of its value in less than a month.

252.title: Pak batters stopped playing reverse lap shot after T20 WC 2007 final: Misbah
252.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Misbah Ul Haq said Pakistan's batters stopped playing reverse lap or sweep shots following his dismissal after playing a scoop shot, in the 2007 T20 World Cup final against India. "No one remembers the 15 fours that I played before [that] but everyone remembers that shot," added Misbah. India beat Pakistan in the final by five runs.

253.title: Old video of Sajid Khan talking about his engagement to Gauahar Khan goes viral
253.article_body: An old video of Sajid Khan admitting he was engaged to Gauahar Khan on Kiran Juneja's show has gone viral. Sajid said he was in a relationship with Gauahar for a year. He said, "Uss waqt mera character bohot dheela tha (In those days, I had a bad character). I used to go around with girls and lie to them."

254.title: Inciting chaos, terror: Iran Prez after US Prez supports protesters
254.article_body: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has accused US President Joe Biden of inciting "chaos, terror and destruction in another country" through his comments, IRNA reported. This comes after Biden expressed his support for people protesting over Mahsa Amini's death. Biden should be "reminded of the eternal words of...founder of the Islamic Republic, who called America the great Satan", Raisi said.

255.title: 300 maar: Passenger to BMW driver in live video minutes before crash in UP
255.article_body: A live video, recorded from inside the BMW minutes before it collided with a truck on the Purvanchal Expressway on Friday, has surfaced online. One of the passengers can be heard telling the driver, "300 maar" (hit 300 kmph). The car was travelling at 230 kmph when it hit the truck, with the bodies of its occupants thrown nearby.

256.title: Thousands take to streets in protest over rising prices in Paris
256.article_body: Thousands of people marched on the streets in Paris on Sunday in a protest over rising prices. The leader of the left-wing political party La France Insoumise, Jean-Luc Melenchon, and this year's Nobel Prize winner for Literature, Annie Ernaux, were seen marching with the protesters. This comes as four unions called for strikes on Tuesday demanding an increase in wages.

257.title: India take 4 wickets on last 4 balls, defeat Australia by 6 runs in T20 WC warm-up match
257.article_body: India defeated Australia by six runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match in Brisbane. Batting first, India posted a total of 186/7, with KL Rahul and Suryakumar Yadav smashing fifties. Australia were bowled out for 180 runs in 20 overs with India taking four wickets on the last four deliveries. Mohammad Shami registered bowling figures of 1-0-4-3.

258.title: Apple freezes plans to use China-based YMTC's chips: Report
258.article_body: Apple has frozen its plans to use memory chips from China's Yangtze Memory Technologies amid increasing political pressure, Nikkei Asia reported citing sources. Apple had originally planned to use YMTC's NAND flash memory chips as early as 2022. The US has added YMTC and 30 other firms to a list of companies that it has been unable to inspect.

259.title: Waiting for a long time for this: Sonia on Cong Presidential poll
259.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Monday cast her vote in Delhi to elect the new party President. "I have been waiting for a long time for this thing," she said. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra also accompanied her mother Sonia Gandhi and cast her vote. Voting for the Congress Presidential poll began at 10 am today.

260.title: Shah Rukh Khan shoots race sequence for 'Dunki' with 500 people: Report
260.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has reportedly shot a race sequence in Mumbai for the Rajkumar Hirani directorial film, 'Dunki'. As per a report, over 500 people gathered for the scene, which was reportedly shot from 6 am to 8 am on Sunday. Apart from Shah Rukh, the scene will reportedly also feature actor Boman Irani.

261.title: Police raid Gurugram warehouse, find over 4,000 kg banned firecrackers
261.article_body: Police raided a warehouse in Gurugram and recovered banned firecrackers weighing 4,235 kilograms, reports said. Reports added that an FIR has been registered against the godown owner who is a native of Delhi. Police said that the matter is being investigated and that the owner of the warehouse will be arrested soon.

262.title: DCW chief Swati says someone broke into her house, vandalised cars; shares pics
262.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women's (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal has said that someone broke into her house on Monday. The person vandalised two cars belonging to Maliwal and her mother, she said, adding that they were not home at the time of attack. Sharing pictures of the damaged cars on Twitter, Maliwal wrote, "Whatever you do, I will not be afraid."

263.title: Shaheen Afridi, Fakhar Zaman join Pak squad for T20 WC, PCB shares video
263.article_body: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi and middle-order batter Fakhar Zaman joined their squad in Brisbane on Sunday for the T20 World Cup in Australia. Both players were in rehab after suffering knee injuries in recent months. Shaheen hurt his knee during a Test against Sri Lanka in July, while Fakhar suffered the injury in the Asia Cup final last month.

264.title: Did not violate guidelines for Congress' presidential polls: Gehlot
264.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has claimed that he did not violate the guidelines for the Congress' presidential elections by seeking votes for candidate Mallikarjun Kharge. "I am Kharge's proposer. Some people created controversy that I campaigned in his support...What I did was in the role of a proposer...I did not violate the election process," said Gehlot.

265.title: I believe Cong’s revival has begun: Tharoor on party's Presidential poll
265.article_body: As voting for the Congress Presidential election began at 10 am today, party leader Shashi Tharoor said, "I believe the revival of Congress has begun." Furthermore, he added, "Today I spoke to Mr Kharge and said whatever has happened, we remain colleagues and friends." Tharoor stated that the fate of the Congress party is in the hands of party workers.

266.title: Will withdraw cases against agitators if we win Gujarat polls: Kejriwal
266.article_body: While addressing a public gathering in Gujarat's Bhavnagar, AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal promised to withdraw cases against various movement leaders within 15 days of the formation of the government. "Now people are looking for a new engine to run the government. They are no more interested in double-engine government, as claimed by the BJP," said Kejriwal.

267.title: People should never fear air turbulence, says Musk; Twitter users react
267.article_body: Responding to a video showing aeroplane wings during turbulence, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "People should never fear turbulence. Commercial airliner wings can handle insane amounts of bending." Commenting on his tweet, a user wrote, "Musk is absolutely right here."  Meanwhile, another tweeted, "It's not always safe for the people inside."

268.title: AAP should stop doing 'pressure politics': BJP over CBI summon to Sisodia
268.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Sunday said AAP should stop doing "pressure politics" after the CBI summoned Deputy CM Manish Sisodia for questioning in Delhi excise policy case. "If you're so scared of probe agencies, then you should not have indulged in corruption. Sisodia is less a Deputy CM and more a corrupt collection agent of Kejriwal," he added.

269.title: Don't want to believe this: Actress Muskan on Vaishali Takkar's death
269.article_body: Actress Muskan Bamne mourned Vaishali Takkar's death and said she doesn't want to believe the news of her passing away. "You were always there for me and treated me like your younger sister. I'll miss you a lot," Muskan wrote in an Instagram post. Muskan played Vaishali's younger sister in the television series 'Super Sisters - Chalega Pyar Ka Jaadu'.

270.title: Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi cast vote to elect new Congress President
270.article_body: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi and General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi cast their vote at AICC office in Delhi to elect the new party president. "I have been waiting for a long time for this thing," Sonia said after casting her vote. Meanwhile, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said that Congress is the only political party to hold elections for its president.

271.title: We're hoping that pacers do well in T20 WC, other teams have belief: Karim
271.article_body: Talking about the T20 World Cup 2022, ex-selector Saba Karim said, "There is a difference between hope and belief. Other teams have...belief that the...pacers in their ranks will bowl well." "We, on the other hand, are hoping that the likes of Mohammad Shami and Bhuvneshwar Kumar...bowl well," added Karim. "Our death bowling is a big issue," Karim had earlier stated.

272.title: Sisodia reaches CBI headquarters, says 'Plan is to arrest me, keep me out of Gujarat'
272.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday morning reached the CBI headquarters for questioning in the Delhi excise policy case and predicted his arrest. "Their (BJP) aim is to send me to jail to stop me from going to Gujarat. Nothing was found against me in the raids," stated Sisodia. "BJP is scared because...[they're] losing Gujarat," he had earlier tweeted.

273.title: Suspected break failure causes Maharashtra bus to hit 8 vehicles, 5 injured
273.article_body: Five people were injured after a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation bus hit at least eight vehicles after a suspected brake failure on Mumbai-Bengaluru Highway. Reports said that those injured were taken to hospital and are out of danger. Reports added that investigators will probe the bus, following which, the exact reason for the failure of brakes will be ascertained.

274.title: Cyberabad Police help candidates who reach wrong exam centres, share pics
274.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Sunday said that its traffic police personnel helped candidates, who're appearing for the Telangana State Public Service Commission Group-1 preliminary examination, after they reached the wrong exam centres by mistake. The police also shared pictures of the traffic police personnel on its Twitter handle, adding that the candidates were escorted to the right centre on time.

275.title: Hair Care Juice reduces 93% of our users' hair fall in 2 months: Kapiva
275.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda reveals that nutrition is essential in combating hair loss & promoting new hair growth. Kapiva's Hair Care Juice is a potent formulation of Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha & Amla that stimulates scalp's bloodstream & effectively strengthens hair follicles than external treatments, Kapiva said. Furthermore, 70% of users experienced faster & newer hair growth, it added.

276.title: Chennai man gifts cars, bikes worth ₹1.2 crore to staff, says 'They helped me earn profits'
276.article_body: A Chennai-based jewellery shop owner has presented cars and bikes worth ₹1.2 crore to his employees as gifts for Diwali. Jayanthi Lal Chayanthi, the owner of Challani Jewellery, gifted eight cars and 18 bikes to his staff and colleagues. "This is to encourage their work...They've worked with me in all ups and downs...and helped me earn profits," Jayanthi Lal said.

277.title: Pune may receive rainfall with thunderstorms till October 19: IMD
277.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted intense rainfall along with thunderstorms and lightning in Pune till October 19, which may disrupt Diwali shopping plans for many. Anupam Kashyapi, head of the weather forecasting division, IMD, Pune, said that there may be a further delay in the withdrawal of monsoon from the southern parts of Maharashtra.

278.title: Winds favouring AAP, people of Gujarat have decided to oust BJP: Punjab CM
278.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said that the people of Gujarat have made up their minds to give a mandate to AAP and oust the BJP from power. He further added that the winds of change are blowing in the favour of AAP. He claimed that the BJP is responsible for plundering the wealth of the people.

279.title: 76 butterfly species spotted across 7 biodiversity parks in Delhi
279.article_body: A total of 76 different butterfly species have been recorded across Delhi's seven biodiversity parks during a week-long 'butterfly assessment week'. The Aravalli Biodiversity Park (ABP) in Vasant Vihar reported the highest number of species (68), followed by the Kamla Nehru Ridge with 59 different species, according to officials. Last year, 71 different species were spotted during the census.

280.title: Ukraine says Russia attacked capital Kyiv with kamikaze drones, video surfaces
280.article_body: At least three explosions have been heard in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv on Monday as Andriy Yermak, head of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's office, said the attacks were from kamikaze drones. Mayor Vitali Klitschko said residential buildings in central Shevchenkivskiy area had been damaged. Social media posts showed a fire in the area of the apparent strike, with black smoke rising.

281.title: Varun Dhawan shares first look of 'Bhediya'
281.article_body: Varun Dhawan shared the first look of his upcoming film 'Bhediya', which will feature him as a werewolf. Sharing the poster, Varun announced that the trailer of the Amar Kaushik directorial will release on October 19. 'Bhediya', which also stars Kriti Sanon, Deepak Dobriyal and Abhishek Banerjee, marks the third project in Maddock Films' horror-comedy genre, following 'Stree' and 'Roohi'.

282.title: Suryakumar heard saying 'Maarne ka mood nahi ho raha hai' on stump mic, gets out next ball
282.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav was heard saying "Maarne ka mood nahi ho raha hai" after reaching his fifty off 32 deliveries against Australia in the T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match. A video of the same has gone viral. Suryakumar got out the next ball after making the remark. India posted a total of 186/7 in their 20 overs.

283.title: It has a GoT kind of feel, says Rohit Sharma on press conference room; ICC shares video
283.article_body: Talking about the room where the press conference for all the 16 captains at T20 World Cup 2022 was held, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said, "It's pretty cool actually, just a 'Game of Thrones' kind of feel." The ICC then shared a video showing moments from the press conference with 'Game of Thrones' theme song in the background.

284.title: BJP is true well-wisher of Muslims: UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak
284.article_body: UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak on Sunday said that the BJP is a true well-wisher of Muslims and it is making meaningful efforts to bring them to the mainstream. "So-called secular parties used Muslims only as a vote bank," Pathak added. "These parties came into power by taking the votes of Muslims but they never got their rights," he stated.

285.title: Selena Gomez, Hailey Bieber pose together at Academy Museum Gala, fans react
285.article_body: Amid feud rumours, Selena Gomez and Hailey Bieber were seen posing together at the recently held 2022 Academy Museum Gala. Photographer Tyrell Hampton shared their picture, which went viral on social media platforms and received reactions from their fans. A fan wrote, "World peace has been found", while another comment read, "This post will go down in history".

286.title: I don't look at non-striker, it's waste of energy: Cummins on 'mankading'
286.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins has termed 'mankading' as a "waste of energy", stating that he never looks at the non-striker during his run-up. Cummins, however, also added, "I think [mankading is] transitioning from something that was maybe frowned upon to something that is considered just a run out." He further said, "I'm not sure every bowler will [attempt mankading]."

287.title: Over 42 lakh pilgrims visited Char Dham in 2022, 311 died since May: Report
287.article_body: Over 42 lakh pilgrims have visited the Char Dham this year, reports said. Reports added that out of the total, 311 pilgrims have died since the yatra started in May this year. So far, 15.14 lakh pilgrims have visited Badrinath, 14.25 lakh have visited Kedarnath, 6 lakh have visited Gangotri and more than 4.73 lakh have visited Yamunotri.

288.title: Haven't had intimate relationship since becoming single mother: Drew Barrymore
288.article_body: Drew Barrymore shared that she hasn't been able to have an intimate relationship after "entering life as a single mom". However, she said she's not someone "who needs sex and has to go out there and engage with people on that level". "A relationship with a man hasn't been top of my mind for a very long time," she added.

289.title: 54 buildings declared dangerous in Mumbai's Borivali, 33 razed
289.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has declared 54 buildings in Borivali's R (central) ward 'dilapidated' and 'dangerous' as per its C1 category of classifying structures. Out of the total, 33 buildings have been demolished, while three more will be demolished after Diwali. The BMC said that it is awaiting court clearance for the demolition of 13 other dilapidated buildings.

290.title: Drake, The Weeknd to boycott Grammy Awards for second consecutive year
290.article_body: Drake and The Weeknd have decided to boycott the Grammy Awards 2023 for the second year in a row and have refused to submit their work to the Recording Academy. The Canadian artists have previously shared their concerns about how things work with the organisation behind the award ceremony. Grammy Awards 2023 nominations will be announced on November 15.

291.title: Whatever we said to each other was on friendly note: Kharge on Tharoor
291.article_body: With the voting underway for the Congress Presidential elections, Mallikarjun Kharge, who is contesting against Shashi Tharoor, said whatever was said before the poll was on a friendly note. "It's a part of our internal election...Tharoor telephoned me and wished me luck and I also said the same," added Kharge. The results are likely to be declared on October 19.

292.title: Pakistani security forces shoot dead 5 militants in Balochistan
292.article_body: Pakistani security forces shot dead five militants in the Mastung area of Balochistan province on Sunday. According to security officials, the operation targeted militants who were linked to a bomb blast that took place in the area, which left three people dead and six others injured. Some security officials were also injured in the operation, counterterrorism police said.

293.title: 16-year-old Indian Grandmaster Gukesh D becomes youngest to beat world champion Carlsen
293.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster Gukesh D created history by becoming the youngest chess player to beat Magnus Carlsen after he became the world champion. Gukesh achieved the feat by defeating the world number one in the ninth round of Aimchess Rapid. Earlier in the tournament, India's 19-year-old Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi had defeated Carlsen.

294.title: Meta's Horizon Worlds failing targets, most users not returning after 1st month: Report
294.article_body: Meta's Horizon Worlds is failing to meet internal performance expectations, according to a report. Internal documents revealed that while 5,00,000 monthly active users were expected on Horizon Worlds by the end of the year, the current figure is less than 2,00,000. The report also said that most users didn't return to Horizon after the first month on the platform.

295.title: Voting begins to elect Congress' next chief between Mallikarjun Kharge & Shashi Tharoor
295.article_body: Voting for the Congress presidential elections began at 10 am today. The fate of the Congress party will be decided by over 9,000 Pradesh Congress Committee delegates who comprise the electoral college for electing the next party chief between Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor. Sonia Gandhi and Manmohan Singh will vote in Delhi, while Rahul Gandhi will vote in Karnataka.

296.title: India reports 2,060 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,834
296.article_body: India reported 2,060 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in India now stand at 26,834. The data showed that 1,841 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The recovery rate in the country currently stands at 98.75%. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached  5,28,905.

297.title: Activists set off fire alarm to disrupt German Chancellor's speech
297.article_body: Environmentalist group, Scientist Rebellion, said on Sunday that its activists set off the fire alarm to interrupt German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's speech at World Health Summit in Berlin. It added that this was done to "draw particular attention to the climate failure of the German government". Some of the group's members also glued their hands to the ground in protest.

298.title: Delhi's air quality slips to 'poor' category; AQI rises to 201
298.article_body: The air quality in the national capital on Monday morning was recorded in 'poor' category as the Air Quality Index (AQI) touched 201, data by SAFAR showed. The air quality is expected to remain in 'poor' category for the next few days, experts warned. The last time Delhi's air deteriorated to the 'poor' category was on October 5, said reports.

299.title: Kohli's form will unleash in a big way in T20 WC: Ex-player Reetinder Sodhi
299.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi has backed Virat Kohli to "score big" in the ongoing 2022 T20 World Cup in Australia. "Big players deliver in important tournaments. It often happens with Kohli," stated Sodhi. Kohli was India's highest-run scorer in the 2022 Asia Cup and has scored 115 runs in his last three T20I innings.

300.title: Students allege harassment at Miranda House fest, share videos of men climbing walls
300.article_body: Students of Delhi's all-women Miranda House alleged they were harassed after men forcibly entered the college to attend a Diwali fest on campus. Several students took to social media to share videos and pictures of men climbing the college's walls and gates. "Cat-calling, groping, sexist sloganeering...Men entering safe spaces to harass gender minorities is nothing new," a student wrote.

301.title: Dr Dilip Mahalanabis, pioneer of oral rehydration therapy, passes away aged 87
301.article_body: Eminent paediatrician Dr Dilip Mahalanabis has passed away at the age of 87, hospital authorities said. He was undergoing treatment for lung infection and other old-age ailments at a private hospital in Kolkata. Dr Mahalanabis was known for pioneering the use of oral rehydration therapy during the outbreak of cholera among refugees of the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War.

302.title: Pune Crime Branch arrests gangster Gajanan in extortion case
302.article_body: The Anti Extortion Cell (AEC) of the Pune Crime Branch arrested gangster Gajanan from Satara in connection with an extortion case. According to police, he had kidnapped a businessman who had invested in shares and tried to extort ₹20 crore from him. A total of 14 people have been booked in the case.

303.title: 11-month-old girl dies as mom attempts suicide with her in Maharashtra lake
303.article_body: An 11-month-old girl died after her mother attempted suicide by jumping into a lake in Maharashtra's Nagpur. The 38-year-old woman was rescued by people while the infant drowned. The mother and the infant were rushed to the hospital where the baby was declared dead. The incident took place around 4:30 pm on Saturday.

304.title: Manish Sisodia writes to LG, says Delhi has become the crime capital
304.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia wrote a letter to LG Vinai Kumar Saxena and claimed that the national capital has become the crime capital. "Criminals have no fear...The Constitution has given you the responsibility to maintain law and order in Delhi. The police reports directly to you. I request you to give some attention to this," wrote Sisodia.

305.title: I've legit nightmares that it's been stolen: Dulquer on his BMW M3 E46 car
305.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan opened up about one of his "beloved" cars, BMW M3 E46, and shared that he has "legit nightmares that it's been stolen, vandalised". "I am really protective of this car," he shared in a video. Reportedly, Dulquer also owns a Ferrari 458 Spider, BMW X6 M, Porsche Panamera Turbo, Mercedes - AMG G63, and Volkswagen Polo GTI.

306.title: 14-yr-old fakes kidnapping in Maha to avoid mother's questions over studies
306.article_body: A 14-year-old girl ran away from home and later told a fake story of her kidnapping to avoid questions about her studies in Maharashtra's Nagpur. "The girl [wanted] to get rid of constant nagging by her mother," said police. The girl claimed that she was kidnapped by two women while the CCTV showed her boarding a bus on her own.

307.title: First case of new Omicron sub-variant BF.7 found in India
307.article_body: Gujarat Biotechnology Research Centre has detected the first case of the Omicron sub-variant BF.7 in India. Dr Madhavi Joshi, senior scientist at Gujarat Biotechnology Research Centre told Mint that panic should not be created and requested people to wear masks, avoid gathering and follow hand hygiene. Notably, two new Omicron sub-variants BF.7 and BA.5.1.7 were recently detected in China.

308.title: Not everybody is a fit for our culture: Ola CEO on his management style
308.article_body: When asked about his management style at the company, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal remarked, "Not everybody is a fit for our culture". Around 36 employees at Ola Electric and ANI Technologies, reportedly quit within a year or two of joining. A report quoting Ola Electric employees said Aggarwal would call staff "useless" or lose patience in meetings over minor issues.

309.title: When we talk of corruption-free TN, we can't trust DMK govt: Piyush Goyal
309.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said the DMK government in Tamil Nadu is involved in corruption and ignored the development of the poor. "When we talk of corruption-free Tamil Nadu, we cannot trust the government…[It is] not taking up the developmental works for the poor but doing the development work for their son and son-in-law," Goyal added.

310.title: 3 of a family dead after suffering burns due to firecracker explosion in Gurugram
310.article_body: Three members of a family died after they suffered severe burn injuries in a firecrackers explosion at their home in a village in Gurugram last week, the police said. Six people, including four members of Bhagwan Das' family, were critically injured in the explosion. Bhagwan Das used to supply firecrackers for use in weddings and other functions, the police said.

311.title: No problem with Congress' ideology: Tharoor ahead of party's chief poll
311.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said he finds no problem with his party's ideology. "I want to bring a change in our way of working. My contender Mallikarjun Kharge is an experienced leader, if he wins, we will work in cooperation naturally," Tharoor added. The Congress Presidential poll is scheduled to be held on Monday.

312.title: Will bear treatment cost: Punjab minister after her escort vehicle hits 2
312.article_body: After her escort vehicle hit two people in Chandigarh, Punjab Cabinet Minister Dr Baljit Kaur said that she will bear all costs of their treatment. She said that the security personnel who were in the vehicle had taken the injured to the hospital on her request as the ambulance was taking time to reach.

313.title: Guardiola claims Liverpool fans threw coins at him, says 'they tried, but didn't get me'
313.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said coins were thrown at him from the stands during their match against Liverpool, which they lost 0-1 on Sunday. The incident reportedly happened after Guardiola reacted angrily to Phil Foden's goal being disallowed following a VAR check in the second half. "All these coins, they tried, but didn't get [me]," said Guardiola.

314.title: Activists pour out milk in shopping aisles in various stores in UK, videos surface
314.article_body: Several anti-dairy activists were seen pouring milk in supermarket aisles and displays across different department stores in the UK to bring attention to their cause. Videos that surfaced on social media showed members of Animal Rebellion, a climate change and animal rights organisation, participating in this at UK stores such as Whole Foods and Marks and Spencer.

315.title: Irrfan Khan's son Babil makes runway debut at Lakme Fashion Week
315.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil Khan made his runway debut at the Lakme Fashion Week on Sunday. Babil, who is making his Bollywood debut with 'Qala', walked the ramp for designer Pawan Sachdeva. Mrunal Thakur was designer Rajesh Pratap Singh's showstopper at the finale show of Lakme Fashion Week. Yami Gautam, Bhagyashree, and others also walked the ramp.

316.title: Group allegedly trespasses on mosque land, performs rituals in Hyd
316.article_body: A group belonging to a particular community allegedly trespassed on Hyderabad's Qutb Shahi mosque land and performed rituals. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Several Muslim people staged a protest following the incident. "The other group is claiming...government had allocated some land there for a temple...On Monday, we expect the issue to be resolved," a police official said.

317.title: Protests in Delhi's Ranjit Nagar after 3 men kill 27-yr-old man, RAF deployed
317.article_body: After three men allegedly killed a 27-year-old man in Delhi's Ranjit Nagar area, local politicians called for a protest on Sunday. The protest was also joined by the deceased's family and supporters. Rapid Action Force companies have been deployed in the area to maintain security, reports said. Police said that they are verifying the sequence of the incident.

318.title: Declared minor after 33 years of trial, Bihar farmer acquitted 10 years later
318.article_body: A 56-year-old Bihar farmer, who was booked in 1979 along with nine others including his father under IPC sections 148 (rioting armed with deadly weapon) and 307 (attempt to murder), has been acquitted. Munna Singh faced trial as an adult for 33 years before it was decided in 2012 that he was a minor at the time of the incident.

319.title: Central Railway to get its sixth air-conditioned local train in Mumbai soon
319.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) will get its sixth air-conditioned (AC) local train in Mumbai soon as a 12-car rake has been already dispatched for Mumbai from Chennai's coach factory. The new AC rake is expected to arrive in a couple of days, after which its commissioning process will start, which will likely take one month, a senior rail official said.

320.title: 2 labourers die while cleaning septic tank at house in Ghaziabad
320.article_body: Two labourers died while cleaning a septic tank at a house in Ghaziabad on Sunday, police said. One of the workers fell unconscious on entering the tank, following which the second worker entered the tank to rescue him but he also collapsed, police added. The labourers were taken to a hospital but were declared dead on arrival, the SHO said.

321.title: Conjunctivitis cases on rise in Mumbai due to changing weather: BMC
321.article_body: Number of conjunctivitis cases are increasing in Mumbai over the past two weeks due to changing weather, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. People must take precautions and timely visit doctors in case they experience pain or discomfort in their eyes, the BMC added. In the last two weeks, 250-300 conjunctivitis patients have been treated in the civic-run hospital.

322.title: Ola CEO called teams 'useless', hurled Punjabi epithets at staff in meetings: Report
322.article_body: Several former and current employees at Ola Electric have alleged that the company's culture has turned hostile over the last couple of years, Bloomberg reported. They accused Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal of directing Punjabi epithets at staff and calling teams "useless" in meetings. Aggarwal would lose patience over a crooked paper clip or quality of printing paper, the employees claimed.

323.title: Pune woman looks for overseas job for her brother, loses ₹8.20 lakh
323.article_body: A 23-year-old woman in Pune lost ₹8.20 lakh while looking for an overseas job opportunity for her brother. A Mumbai-based man had promised to help her to get a job in Scotland. The woman had met the accused during a train journey in 2019. The accused stopped taking her calls after she paid the money to him, reports said.

324.title: Activists spray orange paint on luxury car showroom in London, video surfaces
324.article_body: Activists of 'Just Stop Oil' on Sunday sprayed orange paint on an Aston Martin dealership in London after blocking Park Lane. The incident took place at around 11 am on Sunday when the group blocked the four-lane road alongside Hyde Park and vandalised the dealership. Around 11 people were arrested for obstructing the highway and one for criminal damage.

325.title: OPEC+ members endorse oil production cut after allegations from US
325.article_body: OPEC+ member states came forward to endorse the decision to cut oil production in wake of the US claiming that OPEC+ nations were being pushed by Saudi Arabia into the move. Iraq said the decision was based on economic indicators. Oman and Bahrain also released separate statements that the decision on the 2 million barrels per day reduction was unanimous.

326.title: More than 1.5 mn people have applied for FIFA World Cup passes: Qatar
326.article_body: Qatar said anywhere between 1.5 million and 1.7 million people have applied for compulsory FIFA World Cup pass. The card acts as a visa, match ticket and transportation ticket, and gives access to some fan zones. All travellers to Qatar will need the pass to enter the country from November 1, whether they intend to watch a game or not.

327.title: Should have listened to Russell during Japanese GP: Mercedes F1
327.article_body: Mercedes F1 trackside engineer Andrew Shovlin said the team agrees with driver George Russell that they should not have pitted him at the same time as Lewis Hamilton during the Japanese GP. "We should have done what George was asking, which was to give him the lap in clean air," said Shovlin. Russell finished eighth due to Mercedes' strategy error.

328.title: Tamil Nadu records 279 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
328.article_body: Tamil Nadu reported 279 new cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the health department informed on Sunday. The state capital, Chennai, recorded the maximum number of new cases with 67 people testing positive for the infection, the daily COVID-19 bulletin said. No new deaths due to the infection were recorded. Tamil Nadu's active case count stood at 4,115.

329.title: Started debt restructuring talks with the IMF, India and China: Sri Lankan President
329.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said the nation has begun debt restructuring talks with the IMF, India and China for overcoming its economic crisis. Wickremesinghe said talks have also started with private creditors. He said the funds from World Bank, Asian Development Bank, the US and the EU were being used to pay for the medicine and fertiliser imports.

330.title: West Bengal invites bids to set up 205 EV charging, battery swapping stations
330.article_body: The West Bengal State Electricity Distribution Company Ltd (WBSEDCL) has invited expressions of interest to install 205 charging or battery-swapping stations for electric vehicles. An official said that the infrastructure would be established in public-private partnership (PPP). WBSEDCL said the stations would be installed on its land but maintained by operators who will offer a share of revenue.

331.title: Man Utd-Newcastle match ends in 0-0 draw as Ronaldo's goal ruled offside
331.article_body: Manchester United and Newcastle's Premier League match ended 0-0, ensuring both teams stayed in the table's top six. "We've had our moments and chances today. I'm very proud of our players," said Newcastle manager Eddie Howe after the match. United's Cristiano Ronaldo had a goal ruled offside while Newcastle forward Joelinton's doubleheader hit the crossbar and then the post.

332.title: Lebanon accuses Israeli gunboats of violating territorial waters
332.article_body: The Lebanese army on Sunday alleged that Israeli gunboats entered Lebanon's territorial waters several times on Saturday in an area opposite Ras Naqura. Lebanese authorities said there were four instances of maritime border violations by the gunboats, adding that they were discussing the violations with a United Nations Interim Force. The Israeli military has denied the allegations.

333.title: 2 Karnataka Bank DBUs commence operations
333.article_body: Two digital banking units (DBUs) of Karnataka Bank started operations on Sunday, after Prime Minister Narendra Modi dedicated 75 DBUs to the nation. The two DBUs started operations at Airport Road, Yeyyadi in Mangaluru and Vijayanagara 1st Stage in Mysuru, the bank said. CEO and Chairman MS Mahabaleshwara called the recognition special as the bank steps into its centenary year.

334.title: Haaland fails to score for 1st time in PL as Man City lose against Liverpool
334.article_body: Erling Haaland failed to score for Manchester City for the first time in 10 Premier League matches as they lost to Liverpool 0-1 at Anfield on Sunday. Mohamed Salah scored the lone goal in 76th minute. It's Manchester City's first Premier League defeat of the season. They're now four points behind leaders Arsenal, while Liverpool are eighth in the standings.

335.title: 2 hovercraft ships of Coast Guard sent to Indo-Pak border in Guj
335.article_body: The Indian Coast Guard sent two hovercraft ships from Mangaluru to the India-Pakistan border in Gujarat, Coast Guard Commander (West Zone) Manoj V Badkar said. He added that there is a pressing need for hovercrafts in Gujarat rather than in Mangaluru. India has 18 hovercrafts and Badkar said once the number increases they might be brought back to Mangaluru.

336.title: Biden will act 'methodically' in responding to Saudi Arabia: Sullivan
336.article_body: US President Joe Biden will act "methodically" in deciding the nature of the response to Saudi Arabia's decision of reducing oil production, the US National Security Adviser said on Sunday. The options do, however, include changes to US security assistance, Jake Sullivan added. OPEC+ countries led by Russia and Saudi Arabia declared oil output cuts despite US objections last week.

337.title: Tharoor slams 'netagiri' by colleagues ahead of Cong Prez polls
337.article_body: On the eve of the Congress Presidential polls, Shashi Tharoor, who is contesting against Mallikarjun Kharge, criticised 'netagiri' by his colleagues. "I know that some of my colleagues are indulging in 'netagiri' and telling the party workers that they know what Sonia Gandhi wants and whom she wants," Tharoor said. He added that the Gandhis made their neutrality categorically clear.

338.title: 3 members of a family killed in car-truck collision in UP's Jhansi
338.article_body: Three members of a family were killed when a truck hit their car in UP's Jhansi district in the early hours of Sunday, police said. Another three people, including the car driver, were injured in the accident, as per the police. The deceased include Mohar Singh (65), his wife Malti (62) and his daughter Anita (32), news agency PTI reported.

339.title: Incredible team, effort: Smriti on India's record 7th Women's Asia Cup title
339.article_body: Praising India following their record-extending seventh Women's Asia Cup title, vice-captain Smriti Mandhana took to Twitter and wrote, "Incredible team. Incredible effort. A seventh Asia Cup for India. Can't wait to win many more with this bunch." With an unbeaten 51 runs off 25 balls, Smriti top-scored in the match. India beat Sri Lanka by eight wickets on Saturday.

340.title: Global Hunger Index publishers are 'defaming' India: RSS affiliate
340.article_body: Calling the 2022 Global Hunger Index report "irresponsible and mischievous", the Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM) said that the publishers of the report are "defaming" India and have demanded that the Centre take action against them. The SJM, an RSS affiliate, also called the report "far from reality". India ranked 107 out of 121 countries on the Global Hunger Index.

341.title: Leopard dies after being hit by vehicle in Maharashtra's Amravati
341.article_body: A male leopard died after being hit by an unknown vehicle in the Amravati district of Maharashtra. The incident occurred at around 4.30 am at Rahatgaon-Badnera bypass, a forest official said. The deceased male leopard was around four to five years old and a case has been registered against an unidentified person by the forest department.

342.title: 4 injured as strikes hit Russian region bordering Ukraine: Guv
342.article_body: At least four people were injured after Russia's Belgorod region bordering Ukraine was hit by strikes on Sunday, Russian officials said. The city of Belgorod witnessed around 16 explosions, Russia’s investigative committee, which probes serious crimes, said on Sunday. Russia last week reported an alleged rise in artillery and missile strikes on its territories bordering Ukraine.

343.title: Real Madrid defeat Barça 3-1 in season's 1st El Clasico, top La Liga table
343.article_body: Karim Benzema, Federico Valverde and Rodrygo each scored a goal as Real Madrid defeated Barcelona 3-1 in the season's first El Clasico. With this, Real Madrid took over from Barcelona as the La Liga table toppers with a three-point lead. Barcelona's Ferran Torres scored a goal in the 83rd minute while Real Madrid's Rodrygo converted a penalty in stoppage time.

344.title: Boat carrying labourers capsizes in Bihar, 7 killed
344.article_body: A boat capsized in Bihar's Katihar and claimed the lives of seven people, according to an official. Udayan Mishra, District Magistrate of Katihar, said that the bodies were taken out during an overnight rescue operation conducted by local divers and NDRF personnel. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh for the family of each of the deceased.

345.title: England have got 'mojo back' ahead of T20 WC: Coach Matthew Mott
345.article_body: England's white-ball coach Matthew Mott said that the side has got their "mojo back" ahead of the T20 World Cup. "There's a number of teams that are potential winners of this WC, of which we're one," Mott said. He added, "I think we're in a pretty good spot at the moment...[and] we don't want to be...predictable [in the tournament]."

346.title: ICC names India's predicted playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022
346.article_body: ICC, on its official website, named Team India's predicted playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022. ICC chose Dinesh Karthik as India's wicketkeeper and number six batter in the playing XI instead of Rishabh Pant. Other players include Rohit Sharma (captain), KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, Harshal Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Yuzvendra Chahal and Arshdeep Singh.

347.title: How much prize money did the Women's Asia Cup 2022 winners and runners-up get?
347.article_body: India, who won Women's Asia Cup for a record-extending seventh time, received a total prize money of $20,000. Meanwhile, Sri Lanka, who finished runners-up, won a prize money of $12,500. India fast bowler Renuka Singh won a prize money of $1,000 for being the Player of the Match in the final. Meanwhile, Player of the Tournament Deepti Sharma got $2,000.

348.title: Salman is a brilliant human being, respects women on set: Choreographer Shabina
348.article_body: Choreographer Shabina Khan, speaking about working with Salman Khan, said the actor gives a lot of respect to women on sets. "He's such a brilliant human being [who] started calling me ma'am when I turned dance master," she said, adding, "I requested him not to call me ma'am...but he said...others will address me in the same way that he does."

349.title: Airlines should maintain 4-6 months of cash reserves: CAPA South Asia CEO
349.article_body: Global aviation and consultancy firm CAPA's CEO for South Asia Kapil Kaul urged for a policy to ensure that Indian airlines have cash reserves of four-six months for continuity of operations. The firm estimated that this fiscal, the domestic airline industry could incur losses of about $1.4-1.7 billion. "COVID-19 had an unprecedented impact on the sector," he added.

350.title: US embassy in India releases over 1 lakh work visa appointments for H&L categories
350.article_body: The US embassy in India has announced the release of over 1 lakh work visa appointments for the H&L workers and their families, in view of the "high demand for employment-based visas". "This...reflects our ongoing commitment to H&L workers," it said. The wait time for both interview waiver and first-time appointments has been "cut in half", it added.

351.title: OPEC+ decisions based on economic indicators: Iraq's oil marketing firm
351.article_body: Iraq's Oil Marketing Company SOMO has said that OPEC+ decisions are based on economic indicators.
