"There's...consensus among OPEC+ countries that the best approach in dealing with the oil market conditions...is a pre-emptive approach that supports market stability and provides the future the guidance it needs," it said. OPEC+ ministers have agreed to cut oil production by two million barrels/day.

352.title: To eternity we go: Kareena to Saif on their 10th wedding anniversary
352.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to Instagram and shared old pictures with her husband and actor Saif Ali Khan on their 10th wedding anniversary. Along with the pictures, she wrote, "Me and you. You and Me. To eternity we go...Happy 10 Handsome Man." Reacting to the post, Malaika Arora commented, "Happy anniversary my loves."

353.title: Karan's directorial debut 'Kuch Kuch...' completes 24 yrs, filmmaker pens note
353.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Instagram to celebrate 24 years of his directorial debut 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'. "Time flies...but 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai' will always remain special," he wrote, adding, "My first film!!! Made with my best people, best team...thank you for still making it 'pop' in pop culture even 24 years down the line and keeping it 'cool'."

354.title: Wanted to prove star kids aren't dumb dropouts: Tusshar on writing a book
354.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor, when asked what propelled him to write a book, said, "After my son came into my life, everybody...would ask me: How do you manage? So, I decided to publish...book on [it]." He added, "Besides, the general perception is that star kids are dumb drop-outs, who can hardly string two words together and I wanted to prove...that's not true."

355.title: Let me know what you think of Black Adam: Dwayne Johnson to Varun Dhawan
355.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Twitter and said that he is finally going to see his "hero", Dwayne Johnson, back on the big screen with 'Black Adam'. Reacting to Varun's tweet, Dwayne responded, "Thank you my brother! Can't wait for you to see the film...Let me know what you think." 'Black Adam' is directed by Jaume Collet-Serra.

356.title: 3 more Raj students test positive for hepatitis; tally rises to 44
356.article_body: Three more students of a coaching institute in Rajasthan's Kota have tested positive for hepatitis A, taking the number of those affected by the liver disease to 44. The Kota district administration has submitted a report regarding such cases to the Chief Minister's Office, three days after a NEET aspirant died from the infection during treatment.

357.title: Gujarat wants 'new engine government' not 'double-engine' one: Kejriwal
357.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that Gujarat wants a "new engine government" instead of the "double-engine government". Addressing a rally in Bhavnagar, CM Kejriwal said, "the double-engine is very old, both engines are 40-50 years old...Try for the new party, you do not lose anything for trying." Notably, the "double-engine government" phrase is regularly used by BJP leaders.

358.title: Student misdirected in religion's name: Bihar principal on hijab row
358.article_body: After a college student in Bihar's Muzaffarpur alleged that a male teacher made objectionable remarks when she refused to take off her hijab, the principal said it seems that somebody has misdirected her in the name of religion and hijab. "It's shocking that a Class 11 girl will behave like this," the principal added. Students protested over the issue.

359.title: Sarayu river floods several areas in UP's Gorakhpur
359.article_body: The Sarayu river has flooded several areas of Gola and Barhalganj tehsils in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur district. As many as 296 boats are carrying out the relief work and Prayagraj district officials have been asked to send 12 motor boats to the region. Neighbouring Azamgarh and Deoria districts in UP have also been affected by the flooded river.

360.title: Unverified news on Ankita murder case will prompt action: Police
360.article_body: Head of SIT investigating the Ankita Bhandari murder case, DIG P Renuka Devi, said legal action will be taken against any person or portal airing news about the probe without an official statement. "This is affecting the law and order of the state," said Devi. She added that all facts of the case would be presented in court.

361.title: Turkey denies involvement with migrant incident at Greek border
361.article_body: The Turkish government has denied its involvement in an incident where Greece found 92 illegal migrants near its border with Turkey. The migrants were discovered naked and with injuries on their bodies, Greece had said on Saturday. The Greek government later said the migrants' accounts suggested that they had been forced to enter Greece by the Turkish military police.

362.title: Apple working on dock to turn iPad into smart display: Report
362.article_body: Apple is working on a new dock for the iPad which will allow it to function as smart display and a speaker, according to a report. It is looking to make the tablet similar to an Amazon Echo Show-like device that can be put atop a counter, the report added. The docking station will allow hands-free management of home devices.

363.title: Video shows massive fire engulfing 24-storey skyscraper in Istanbul
363.article_body: Footage of a massive fire that tore through every floor of a 24-storey building in Istanbul has gone viral online. Skies in the area can be seen covered in thick black smoke from the blaze reported in Turkey's capital city. A fire had broken out in the same area due to a gas leak recently, killing three people.

364.title: Top seed Rublev wins inaugural Gijon Open for his 4th title of 2022
364.article_body: Top seed Andrey Rublev defeated unseeded Sebastian Korda 6-2, 6-3 in the Gijon Open final to win his fourth title of the season on Sunday. The world number nine beat Ilya Ivashka, Tommy Paul and US Open 2020 champion Dominic Thiem en route to the final of the inaugural tournament. Overall, it was Rublev's 12th ATP title in men's singles.

365.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
365.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, stated that heavy to very heavy rainfall is very likely over Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from October 17 to October 20. Further, it's very likely over Maharashtra and Goa on October 17, over Karnataka on October 17 and October 20, and over Lakshadweep from October 18 to October 20.

366.title: Bilkis Bano case about us all, the schizophrenic society we are: Moitra
366.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra said the release of the 11 convicts in the 2002 Bilkis Bano case is about all of us, "the schizophrenic society that we are". "The law...allowed these men to walk free, but the people...celebrated these men with tilaks, ladoos and garlands. This [speaks volumes of] mindset of India's current citizens, which...is far more worrying," Moitra added.

367.title: Man pushed out of moving train after fight in Bengal; injured
367.article_body: A man was injured after being pushed out of a moving train in West Bengal's Birbhum district by a fellow passenger following an argument. The man was rescued and taken to a hospital where his condition was stated to be stable. One person was arrested, while the police suspected the involvement of more persons in the crime.

368.title: Salman Khan consumes drugs, don't know about Aamir Khan: Baba Ramdev
368.article_body: While launching a movement against drugs, Baba Ramdev, at an event alleged that actor Salman Khan consumes drugs, adding that he doesn't know whether Aamir Khan also consumes drugs. He also recalled the Mumbai cruise drugs case involving Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan. "We should take a resolution that India must be free from every drug addiction," he stated.

369.title: UP Police salutes K9 dog for helping solve murder case in 48 hours
369.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police on Sunday saluted a K9 dog for helping trace a suspect in a murder case within 48 hours. A 15-year-old boy was murdered and his body was buried at a farm in Kasganj, police said. Not only did the ace detective reach the killers, but also tracked a looted tractor parked 22 kilometres away, police added.

370.title: Abdu's popularity didn't come as surprise: Bigg Boss 16's Sreejita
370.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Sreejita De, who was evicted from the show, has said that Abdu Rozik's popularity did not come as a surprise for her. "I liked him within 1-2 days. He is very genuine, cute and pure-hearted. I wish I had come on another season due to Abdu's popularity and him getting all the attention," she added.

371.title: Punjab court summons Finance Minister Cheema in defamation case
371.article_body: A court in Punjab's Moga has summoned the state's Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema on November 15 in an alleged defamation case filed by ex-MLA Harjot Kamal. Kamal, who switched to BJP from Congress earlier this year, has alleged that Cheema dragged his name in the alleged land acquisition scam of highway number 105-B.

372.title: Brazil have great chance of winning FIFA World Cup 2022: Cafu
372.article_body: Brazil have a great chance of winning the FIFA World Cup in Qatar this year, said former Brazilian footballer Cafu. "Brazil today are much more prepared and experienced. The team does not depend exclusively on a single player. Instead we have a group that makes him (Neymar Jr) stand out," he added. World Cup will begin on November 20.

373.title: 38-yr-old UP BJP leader killed as car collides with pick-up vehicle
373.article_body: A member of Uttar Pradesh BJP's Meerut district unit working committee was killed and four others were injured after a speeding car in which they were travelling collided with a pick-up vehicle on Sunday. The 38-year-old BJP leader, Gaurav Chauhan, was declared dead at a primary health centre. All others injured were sent to a higher health centre for treatment.

374.title: India may become 3rd biggest economy behind US & China by FY28: Report
374.article_body: According to IMF World Economic Outlook database, India could overtake Germany and Japan and become the third biggest economy globally. The top two economies will continue to be the United States and China, Economic Times reported. Notably on Saturday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that Indian economy is projected to grow at 7% in the current fiscal despite global headwinds.

375.title: A film's language should be where the story is set: Gul Panag
375.article_body: Actress Gul Panag has said, "Films should be made in the language which is most natural to where the story is set." She questioned why Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Veer-Zaara' was not made in Punjabi. Gul added that language is a secondary part of filmmaking and stated that the primary part is to be authentic to the story.

376.title: I miss Rishi Kapoor on social media, he was very funny: Karan
376.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said in an interview that he misses Rishi Kapoor on social media. He added that the late actor was very funny and "so amazingly candid". "Every time I feel like...industry is going through some turbulence I'm like 'If Chintu ji was here, he would have really given a good, kadak (solid) jawab (answer) to many...people'," said Karan.

377.title: Tremendous start to T20 WC 2022: Bishop after Namibia's win over Sri Lanka
377.article_body: Reacting to Namibia's win over Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup 2022, Ian Bishop tweeted, "Tremendous start to T20 World Cup 2022. Biggest take-down of Gerhard Erasmus and Namibia crickets journey so far." Ex-South African cricketer Albie Morkel said, "This is what dreams are made of. Amazing day. Well done champs." Robin Uthappa wrote on Twitter, "Phenomenal performance by Namibia."

378.title: Bihar girl asked to remove hijab during exam, creates 'ruckus'; college responds
378.article_body: A college student in Bihar's Muzaffarpur has alleged that a male teacher passed objectionable comments after he asked her to remove her hijab during an exam and she refused. She reportedly claimed the teacher called her an "anti-national". "She was...asked to reveal her ears since there were apprehensions that she might be carrying a Bluetooth device," the college's Principal said.

379.title: I still feel I have a long way to go: Rakul on her journey in film industry
379.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about her journey in the film industry, said, "I still feel I have a long way to go and there's a lot more, I am hungry [for] more work." "But at the same time, I am extremely thankful because this journey has only been possible due to the love of the audience," she added.

380.title: 75 digital banking units set up in record 6 months: RBI Governor
380.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi on Sunday dedicated 75 Digital Banking Units (DBUs) to the nation, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said these DBUs were set up in a record six months in 75 districts spread across the country to commemorate 75 years of independence. "It is a special banking facility that'll provide maximum services through minimum digital infrastructure," he added.

381.title: WSJ ad seeks sanctions against FM Sitharaman & top Indian officials, govt reacts
381.article_body: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has reacted after a full-page advertisement in the US newspaper Wall Street Journal (WSJ) called for sanctions against Finance Minister (FM) Nirmala Sitharaman and other senior government officials. "It's a campaign against India's sovereignty," said Ministry advisor Kanchan Gupta. He said fugitive Devas CEO Ramachandra Vishwanathan was behind the ad.

382.title: Darcie Brown bowls fastest delivery in the history of Women's Big Bash League
382.article_body: Adelaide Strikers Women's 19-year-old fast bowler Darcie Brown on Sunday created history by bowling the fastest ever delivery in the history of Women's Big Bash League. Darcie set the record by clocking 127.2 km/h in her first over against Melbourne Renegades Women. Darcie registered figures of 3-0-28-0 in the match.

383.title: Still struggling to process T20 WC win over UAE: Netherlands captain
383.article_body: Netherlands captain Scott Edwards said he is "still struggling to process" the team's last-over win against UAE in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. "It was nervy...the main thing is relief, getting the tournament underway with a win is the most important," said Edwards. Netherlands chased down 112-run target with one ball and three wickets to spare.

384.title: Nearly 9,000 Russian troops will be stationed in country: Belarus
384.article_body: Belarus's Defence Ministry has said just under 9,000 Russian troops would be stationed in the country as part of a "regional grouping" of forces to protect its borders. "The first convoys of Russian servicemen...have arrived," the ministry said on Saturday. Belarus declared the joint troop deployment last week, saying it was in response to "threats" from Ukraine and the West.

385.title: 'Acche din, oops!' Congress shares parody video mocking PM Modi
385.article_body: Responding to BJP's parody video mocking Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Congress on Sunday shared a video mocking PM Narendra Modi. In the video, a man can be seen holding a cylinder and crying, referring to the increasing price of gas cylinders. Furthermore, a man criticises PM Modi over the rising prices of fuel in the country in the video.

386.title: Players who test COVID-19 positive will be allowed to play T20 World Cup matches
386.article_body: The ICC confirmed that players who test COVID-19 positive will be permitted to play T20 World Cup 2022 matches. It stated that there will no mandatory testing during the tournament and no isolation period if a player gets COVID-19. Team doctors will assess whether it's appropriate for players to compete if they contract the virus on case to case basis.

387.title: 16-year-old UAE cricketer Aayan falls after tripping over boundary rope, video goes viral
387.article_body: While walking back to the pavilion after getting out against Netherlands in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, UAE's 16-year-old all-rounder Aayan Afzal Khan fell after tripping over the boundary rope. A video of the same went viral. In the video, the spectators sitting near the boundary rope can be seen jumping from their chairs on seeing Aayan fall.

388.title: Asked director, why'd a man wear underpants outside trousers: Brosnan on Batman
388.article_body: Actor Pierce Brosnan revealed that he auditioned for the 1989 film 'Batman', which was directed by Tim Burton. "I remember saying something stupid to Tim Burton. I said, 'You know, I can't understand [why] any man would wear his underpants outside his trousers'," he added. The role was eventually played by Michael Keaton.

389.title: 'Frustration+Desperation= Animation': Cong on BJP video mocking Rahul
389.article_body: Responding to a parody video that mocked Congress Rahul Gandhi, Congress General Secretary in-charge Communications Jairam Ramesh said, "BJP's latest formula to counter the success of the Bharat Jodo Yatra. Frustration + Desperation = Animation." He added, "To call the video they have put out pathetic is an understatement!" The video also took a jibe at Congress' Sonia Gandhi.

390.title: Man using phone while crossing road in UP hit by speeding car; video surfaces
390.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Bisalpur died after he was hit by a speeding car when he was crossing a road while using his phone. CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced on social media showing the car hitting the man from the back. The youth's family rushed him to a hospital where he was declared brought dead.

391.title: Ukrainian advances repelled in several regions, Russia says
391.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Sunday said that its troops had repelled efforts by Ukrainian forces to make territorial gains in the Donetsk, Kherson and Mykolaiv regions. The ministry also said Russian forces had inflicted what it called significant losses against the enemy. Russia also said it was continuing air strikes on military and energy targets in Ukraine, using precision-guided weapons.

392.title: Finch is a scary proposition for any opposition team: Cummins
392.article_body: Australian pacer Pat Cummins said that batter Aaron Finch is a "scary proposition for any opposition" team. "He's (Finch) got 3,000 T20I runs to his name, and he's still brave enough to take the game on. Big tournament for him I'm sure," Cummins said. Notably, Finch has scored just one fifty in his last 10 T20I games.

393.title: BJP holds '1st ever' Pasmanda Muslims meet in Lucknow
393.article_body: BJP organised a meeting with key members of the Pasmanda Muslim community in Lucknow, UP on Sunday. The party claims that it is the first such meeting ever held by a political party with the Pasmandas. The meet was called the 'Pasmanda Buddhijeevi Sammelan' and was attended by several senior leaders of the party, including UP's Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak.

394.title: UP village head injured, father killed with sticks in dispute
394.article_body: A village head was injured and his 60-year-old father killed after a group of people attacked them over a dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur. The duo was attacked with sticks by a dozen men. There was a dispute between both groups over some construction work, but the police pacified them. They came face to face again at night.

395.title: Oil markets going through great fluctuations: OPEC Secretary General
395.article_body: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) Secretary General Haitham Al Ghais on Sunday that "oil markets are going through a stage of great fluctuations". He further said that the goal of OPEC is to maintain market stability. Notably, OPEC+ has decided to cut oil production by two million barrels a day from November.

396.title: Content produced in OTTs is inclined towards pornography: Govvind
396.article_body: Actor Govvind Namdev has said that the content produced by OTT platforms is more inclined towards pornography as the medium does not have a censor board. "You are openly showing lovemaking, which makes it very uncomfortable for people to watch with family," he added. However, he stated that things are changing as the problems are being addressed.

397.title: 2 killed as car rams into wall in Rajasthan's Nagaur
397.article_body: A car rammed into a wall in Rajasthan's Nagaur district leading to two people getting killed while two others got injured. The deceased have been identified as Virendra Singh (50) and Ramdhan Singh (38) while the injured, Raju Meghwal and Prem Singh, have been admitted to a government hospital, police said. The deceased's bodies were handed over to their relatives.

398.title: UP minister throws mic, tells party workers 'speak if you're a bigger politician'
398.article_body: A video has surfaced online, purportedly showing Uttar Pradesh minister Sanjay Kumar Nishad throwing his microphone on stage after getting angry during a party event in Mau. This came after he reportedly spotted party workers talking among themselves and not paying attention to his speech. "If you are a bigger politician than me, then speak or else listen," he said.

399.title: What are the features of India's first all-aluminium freight rake?
399.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday flagged off the first indigenously manufactured aluminium goods train rake from Bhubaneswar. It is lighter in weight, demands lower maintenance, has a longer life, promises an 80% resale value and its 180-tonne extra carrying capacity results in higher throughput per wagon. A single aluminium rake in its lifetime saves over 14,500 tonnes of CO2.

400.title: Coal is going to be back as gas has become unaffordable: Sitharaman
400.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said coal is going to be back as gas has become unaffordable and isn't available as much as required. Speaking about an old thermal plant being refurbished to produce electricity in the UK, Sitharaman said, "It is now reviving itself as a thermal unit. So, it's not just India, many countries have gone back."
